loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are attending school. She operates a kiosk selling to her neighbors. Lack of enough capital is her major challenge. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Peris lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She dreams of opening a shop in the near future. She has been in this business for the last year.

With the loan of Ksh 20,000, she plans to purchase maize flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Lida and her husband, using their motorcycle, are delivering breads and cakes to some sari-sari stores in their community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients in making breads, pastries, and cakes, like sugar, flour, and eggs. She will also pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle.

Lida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads, cakes, cookies, and pastries

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong is a 53-year-old married woman who has been residing in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a local rice farmer who plants and sells rice for her income. Her husband also works in the same business as her. Duong wants to provide basic living needs and good educations for her children, so she has a strong determination to achieve her goal. She presently is responsible for five children, one of whom is still single and attending high school. 

At the present, Duong is seeking a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to purchase extra farmland to improve her farming business. Someday, with good profits from the business, she will attain a successful life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase extra farmland to improve her farming business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 32 years old. She is the mother of four children and all of them go to school. She has been running a canteen for the past two years. The loan requested will be used for buying more fresh milk, sugar, breads, and sodas for selling in her canteen. With the profits, she will pay for the school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh milk, sugar, breads, and sodas for selling

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo Mario y tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales sólo 4 viven con ellos. La casa donde viven es propia y está ubicada en una comunidad nativa del Perené.
Las actividades que realiza son varias; empezando el día atiende a familia para que ellos también inicien sus actividades diarias, al culminar sus labores del hogar se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivos. Actualmente cuenta con 5 lotes de tierras fértiles que su comunidad le brindó, en ellas siembra tanyarinas, achiote, café, plátano, yuca, carambolas y cacao. “Sembrar de todo me conviene mucho, porque cada producto se cosecha en meses distintos, así abastezco a mi familia en todo el año”, afirma. La producción de cítricos es común en su localidad, por eso los compradores llegan hasta sus sembríos para adquirir su producción. Así ahorra el pago de transporte. Sofía recibe el apoyo se su esposo, quien trabaja con entrega y dedicación a sus cultivos. Gracias a su esfuerzo pueden asegurar el alimento, vestido y educación de sus hijos. Sus metas más cercanas son de ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos y mejorar su producción, para eso deberá invertir en la compra de terrenos y fertilizantes.

Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki” y se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo tan unido y organizado.
El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cítricos y cacao, cuya cosecha inicia este mes. También pagará a los operarios que contratará para estas faenas.
texts.en: Sofía is 46 years old, lives with her husband Mario and has six children, of whom only four live with them in a home they own in the native community of Perené, Peru. Sofía carries out a number of tasks. She starts the day tending to her family so they too begin their daily activities, and she dedicates herself to her fields of crops before finishing the day with her household responsibilities. She currently has five plots of fertile land that her community provided, on which she plants tangerines, annatto, coffee, bananas, yucca, star fruit and cocoa. "Planting everything suits me well because every crop is harvested in specific months, so my family is supplied for the entire years," she says. Producing citrus fruits is common in her community, so buyers arrive after the harvest to acquire her products, saving her transportation costs. Sofía receives the support of her husband, who works on delivering and tending the crops. Thanks to her hard work she has been able to feed, clothe and educate her children. Her near-term goals are to expand her plots and increase her production, for which she plans to invest in the purchase of land and fertilizer. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. She belongs to the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, and feels good about being part of such a united and organized group. She plans to use the money she is requesting to purchase fertilizers for her citrus and cocoa crops, whose harvest beings this month. She will also hire workers to carry out these tasks.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and hire workers.

loans.name: Savong

texts.en:
Savong is 33 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a rural area of the Dambae district, Cambodia. He has no kids. He earns a living by selling soup in the village and he has been in this business for two years. With his current business, he can earn a daily income of up to US $63, of which he can manage to save only around US $9 per day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Savong with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, he wants to use this loan to buy construction materials to build a small store to sell soup and also buy necessary items for his business. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a decent store to serve more customers and also hopes to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to build a small store and buy necessary items for his soup business

loans.name: Evemi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EVEMI est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommé Candide, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Candide est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Alexis. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Candide vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Candide a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Candide mène comme activité la vente de divers, et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Candide vend aussi de façon secondaire de charbon de bois à son domicile depuis quatre ans. Candide s'approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Candide sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EVEMI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The EVEMI group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Candide, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. 

Candide is 30 years old and she is married to a man named Alexis. Candide and Alexis have two children, both in school and their dependents. Candide lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband. She left school at the secondary level.

Candide sells various goods, as well as mobile phone recharge cards.  Additionally, she has been selling charcoal, from her home, for the past four years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Eager to better meet her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Candide is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the EVEMI group.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharge cards, bags of charcoal and other various goods.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 42 años, vive con Isabel, con quien tiene 2 hijos, de 18 y 16 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.
Como hombre agricultor él tiene un carácter decidido para afrontar esta actividad y programar las siembras de tal manera que las fechas de cosecha coincidan con los meses donde el precio sea más favorable. Actualmente cuenta con 5 parcelas que están produciendo cítricos, café, plátanos y palta.  Benito vive en esa comunidad desde que tenía 8 años, por eso conoce muy bien la zona y sabe qué frutos producen con éxito. "Ahora la cosecha de naranjas y mandarinas es rentable. Sus precios son buenos", comenta. Así también, cuenta con 2 motocarros con los que ofrece el servicio de transporte a los pobladores de su localidad. Para el futuro, espera adquirir otros terrenos para sembrar café y mejorar su producción. "El café orgánico tiene más demanda", menciona.

Éste es su préstamo número 8 que tiene con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", uno de los grupos más sólidos de la selva central. Por su parte, él muestra entusiasmo en las actividades que se desarrollan.
Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina “macheteadora” con la que optimizará el trabajo de limpieza de sus cultivos. Calcula que le costará 1600 soles.
texts.en: Benito is 42 years old and lives with Isabel, with whom he has two children, ages 18 and 16. They all live together in their own home in the native community of Chanchamayo, Peru. As a farmer, he has the character to take on this activity and schedules his plantings in such a way that his harvests coincide with the months where they will fetch the best prices. He currently has five parcels producing citrus fruits, coffee, bananas and avocado. Benito has lived in this community since he was 8 years old, so he is well known in the area and knows how to successfully grow fruit. "Right now harvesting oranges and mandarins is lucrative. The prices are good," he says. He also has two vehicles to transport the products locally. In the future, he hopes to add more land to plant coffee and increase his production. "Organic coffee has more demand," he says. This will be his eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time. He belongs to the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, one of the tightest-knit groups in the area, and for his part, Benito shows enthusiasm for the group's activities. With the money he is requesting, he plans to purchase a machine to optimize the cleaning of his crops. He estimates it will cost him 1,600 soles.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to clean his crops.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Robert. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie vend des produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc, etc.) dans sa boutique. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Marie désire augmenter son stock de produits. Pour ce faire, Marie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHOUGNON group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Marie, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.

Marie is married to a carpenter named Robert. Marie and Robert have three children, whom they financially support.  Some of their children attend school.  Marie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband. She has never attended school.

Marie sells food products (maize, cassava flour etc.) in her shop.

Eager to better meet her customers' needs and to boost her income, Marie would like to increase her stock of products. To this end, she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the MAHOUGNON group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and cassava flour.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 53 años, está casada y vive con dos de sus siete hijos. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Rosa de Ubiriki en Chanchamayo.

A pesar de su edad, se entrega a las labores del campo con el mismo esfuerzo de hace 20 años, el mismo tiempo que lleva dedicándose a la agricultura. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Huancayo y llegó a la selva central para formar una familia y desde entonces aprendió a cultivar cítricos, yucas y piñas. Cuenta con una parcela de cítricos y siete de piñas. "Me conviene producir piñas, su precio es bueno y la demanda también, aunque su temporada sea de dos meses, me ayudo con la yuca", comenta. Con esta actividad pudo mantener a su numerosa familia y lo continúa haciendo. Ahora piensa cultivar otros productos como naranjas y mandarinas para surtir sus frutos y generar ingresos para otros meses.

Éste es su préstamo número 8 que tiene con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Victoria pertenece al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" y se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo sólido y de personas responsables.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá comprar semillas de piña y bolsas de fertilizantes para sembrar más frutos. También pagará a los operarios quienes echarán el abono y limpiarán sus cultivos.
texts.en: Victoria is 53 years old, married and lives with two of her seven children in their own home in the native community of Santa Rosa de Ubiriki in Chanchamayo, Peru. Despite her age, Victoria has worked in the fields with the same vigor for the past 20 years, dedicating herself to agriculture. She is a native of the city of Huancayo and came to the central jungle to start a family, and since that time she learned how to grow citrus fruits, yucca and pineapple. She has a parcel of citrus fruit and seven of pineapple. "Growing pineapple suits me. The price is good and so is the demand, although its in season for only two months. It helps me with the yucca," she says. With this activity she was able to have a large family and continue working. Now she plans to grow other crops like oranges and mandarins to stock up on fruit and generate income during other months. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. Victoria belongs to "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, and feels good about being part of a united group of responsible people. She plans to use the money she is requesting to purchase pineapple seeds and bags of fertilizer to plant more fruits. She also will pay workers to take out the manure and clean her crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Soib

texts.ru: Соиб проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он 4 года. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Soib lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  He offers taxi services.  He has lived in this area for the past four years.  He is taking a loan to buy a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Elyana

texts.ru: Elyana 12 let kak vedet biznes v sfere torgovli. Ey 52 goda, ona zamujem I u nee dvoe vzroslix detey. Ona prodaet ovoshi, zelen I frukti. Ey pomogayut dvoe ee rabotnikov. Krome doxoda s ee biznesa ona poluchaet pensiyu. Ona xochet kupit mashinu dla togo chtobi perevozit produkti dla prodaji I v drugie rayoni. Elyana obratilas za summoy v 1000 AZN.
texts.en:
Elyana has been involved in small retail business for the past twelve years.  She is 52 years old, married, and she has two grown-up children.  

She sells greens, fruits and vegetables.  She has two people working with her.  Beside the income she makes from her business, she also receives a pension.  She wants to buy a car to transport her produce for resale to different districts.  Elyana is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport the products she sells to other villages.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells various items like softdrinks, vinegar, and eggs. Aside from the store, Ma. Magdalina also sells Avon products and home-cooked meals. She works hard to support herself and her family.

Ma. Magdalina is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and food vending inventory. She hopes to have a big business in the future. She also hopes to acquire a car.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and food vending inventory

loans.name: Toktogul

texts.ru:
Токтогул 59 лет, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. Токтогул работает учителем в школе села Кайынды - Булак и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1977 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 6,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Токтогул на сегодняшний  день имеется  10 овец, 2 коровы с телятами и 1 лошадь.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтогул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Токтогул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Toktogul is 59 years old.  She is a widow, and she has raised six children. She works as a school-teacher in the village of Kaindy-Bulak.  

In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1977, starting her business with an initial amount of 6,000 som (KGS).  Toktogul currently owns one horse, ten sheep and two cows with their calves.  

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS).  This loan will be used to purchase additional livestock.  Toktogul plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her animal-husbandry business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosa Zenaida

texts.es:
ROSA ZENAIDA tiene 44 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijosen Gauaranda provincia de Bolívar.

ROSA ZENAIDA es profesora en un escuela. Solicita el crédito para comprar cabinas telefónicas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá emoprender un negocio.

La compra de las cabinas lo hará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder ampliar el negocio y comprar más cabinas.

El desafío que tiene es poder sacar una maestria. En el tiempo libre le gusta areglar la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Zenaida is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Guaranda, which is in Bolívar Province.

Rosa Zenaida is a teacher at a school. She is requesting a loan to buy telephone calling stations. With the help of this loan, she will be able to start a business. The purchase of the stations will be made in Guaranda. Her dream is to expand the business and acquire more stations. Rosa's challenge is being able to obtain a Master's degree.

In her free time, she enjoys fixing up her house.

loans.use: to buy telephone calling stations.

loans.name: Gloriefe

texts.en:
Gloriefe, single, 32 years old, resides at Migcanaway, Tangub City, Philippines. Gloriefe owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn her living. She's had 2 years of experience in this business. 

Each month, Gloriefe earns 6,000 PHP operating this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Gloriefe hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 58 years old and lives in Nailon,Tudela. She is married and has 2 children. 

Nelly has a general store. She has had this business for 20 years. Nelly has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Nelly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 22 years old. He is single, with the dedication of making himself a very renowned entrepreneur in the future. He sells shoes and has been in the business for four years. The profits from the business will be used for savings in order to accumulate capital to reinvest in the same business. He would love to see himself as a successful business man in the future.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alogo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOGO est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Irène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Irène est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Irène a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Irène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de trois ans que Irène mène comme activité la vente de condiments à son domicile. Irène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Irène sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOGO. le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The ALOGO group is comprised of three people who live in the same house. The representative of this group is Irene, and she’s the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the second time that this group has asked for financial support from ALIDé to expand its business. 

Irene is 32 years old and is married to a woodworker named Albert. The couple has three dependent children, some of whom go to school. Irene stopped going to school after elementary school. Irene lives with her husband and her children, and she and her husband take care of the various household responsibilities. 

For nearly 3 years now, Irene has been selling condiments out of her home. Irene buys her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of better satisfying her clients and growing her revenue, Irene and the other members of the ALOGO group are asking for their second loan from ALIDé. Their first loan was repaid.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 47, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is widowed and has 5 children. She, together with her children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Elvira earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from the store, she has videoke machines. A videoke is a combined term for video karaoke. Elvira earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She operates a small area of her house as a small videoke machine rental, where people can hang out and sing. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Elvira is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvira hopes to be able to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 25 years old. She sells clothes for kids. She has been selling clothes for five years. She has requested a loan to buy more clothes for sale. The profits will be used for providing food for the family and build savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Brenda has a shop that sells RTWs (Ready to Wear clothing) and cosmetics. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more inventory of clothes to sell like blouses, t-shirts, pants, and underwear, as well as deodorant, herbal oils, and lotions.
Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy inventory of clothing to sell

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut, 50, is a widower living in the rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. He has four children, three of whom are still in school. He earns a living to feed his children through planting cassava and red maize. He supplements his income by farming rice on the three-hectare farmland. The main challenge for his business is the low crop yield which has made him earn less to support the family. His daily income earned from his current business is 20,000 KHR and can save only 5,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Mut with VisionFund. Now applying for a loan with VisionFund, he is going to use this loan to spend for land preparation and buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields and earn more income to better feed and support his children.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita is 50 years old and lives in Bliss Cabol-anonan,Tudela. She is married with 4 children. Marita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 2 years. Marita requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Marita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Marita hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents for sale

loans.name: Ernesto De Jesus

texts.es:
Ernesto, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, uno de ellos esta fuera del hogar, casado, él es agricultor en pequeño, aprendió como ayudante y hoy en dia realiza su propia labor con 25 años de experiencia. 
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla y pago de mozos, tambien pagara el alquiler del terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para realizar la siembra, fortaleciendo su trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia en la alimentación.
El objetivo de Ernesto es comprarse un terreno propio, en el cual sembrar pudiendo agregar otros rubros para el mejoramiento de sus ingresos y el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Ernesto lives with his wife and has three children. One of them is married and lives outside of their home. He is a small farmer who learned the trade as an assistant. Today he works on his own and has 25 years of experience.

Ernesto is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, herbicides, and seeds. He will also pay his workers and pay the rent on his farmland. This loan will help him to have everything he needs for planting. By strengthening his business, Ernesto will be able to feed his family. His goal is to buy his own land so that he can engage in additional activities that will improve his income for sustaining his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, seeds, and to pay his workers and the rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Johana Estefania

texts.es:
Johana tiene 22 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, cuando se caso se fue a vivir a la casa de la suegra y ella le enseño el negocio que conoce desde hace 30 años. Hoy en día Johana tiene un año y medio de dedicarse al negocio de los mariscos, ya conoce las especies que más se venden, nombres, precios promedio, época de venta y como prepararlos.

Toda la mercadería se la llegan a vender a la casa donde tiene el negocio. Ella tiene la ventaja que vive cerca de la playa, por que casi todos los pescadores son vecinos de ella y ellos mismos se encargan de distribuir la pesca en la zona para su comercialización.

Johann solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar mariscos, pescado, langosta, jaibas, pero sobre todo el camarón, ya que es el que tiene más demanda y es el más caro. Con la inversión dispondrá de dinero suficiente para expandir su venta más que todo en la compra de camarón y langosta. Así, ella se independizara, ya que hasta el momento trabaja junto con su suegra. Pero con el préstamo se le abrirán las puertas para comenzar con su propio negocio.

Su deseo es vivir en una casa propia en la misma zona y administrar su negocio por ella misma con propósitos de crecer.
texts.en:
Johana is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She previously devoted herself to doing household chores, but when she got married, she went to go live at her mother-in-law's house. Her mother-in-law taught her the business that she was in for 30 years. Today Johana has been in the business of selling seafood for a year and a half. She is already knowledgeable about what types of seafood sell the most, their names, their average prices, when certain seafood is in season, and how it should be prepared.

All of the merchandise is sold from her house, since that is where her business is located. She has the advantage of living near the beach, where almost all of the fishermen are her neighbors. They are the ones responsible for distributing the fish throughout the area in order to be sold.

Johana is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy shellfish, fish, lobsters, crabs, and most of all, shrimp since it is in high demand and very expensive. This investment will provide her with sufficient funds to expand her sales, but most of all, she will be able to buy shrimp and lobsters. Johana desires to be independent, but up to now, she has worked alongside her mother-in-law. This loan will open up opportunities for her to start her own business.

Her wish is to live in her own home in the same area and manage her business with the intention of making it grow.

loans.use: to buy shellfish, fish, lobsters, crabs, and shrimp.

loans.name: Olga Teresa

texts.es:
OLGA TERESA tiene 24 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad vive con el conyugue y con los hijos en Gauaranda provincia de Bolívar.

OLGA TERESA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas y cebolla. Solicita el crédito para comprar cebollas, arveja, habas, coliflor, papas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar la mercadería que tanta falta le hacía. Las compras lo hará en Ambato. 

El sueño es poder mejorar economicamente y poder tener algún bien. El desfío que tiene es poder llegar hacer un Ingeniero Agronomo.

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música. En la fotografia apararece junto al esposo.
texts.en:
Olga Teresa is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a two-year-old child. She lives with them in Guaranda, which is in Bolívar Province.

Olga Teresa is a farmer who grows potatoes and onions. She is requesting a loan in order to buy onions, peas, beans, cauliflower, and potatoes. With the help of this loan, she will buy merchandise that she is lacking. These items will be purchased in Ambato. Her dream is to improve financially and to have something good. Olga's challenge is being able to become an agricultural engineer.

In her free time, she enjoys listening to music. Her husband appears with her in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy onions, peas, beans, cauliflower, and potatoes.

loans.name: Mayra Patricia

texts.es:
MAYRA PATRICIA tiene 25 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar.

 MAYRA PATRICIA se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas y caballeros. Solicita el crédito para comprar ropa cómo pantalones, sueteres, camisetas, chompas para damas y caballeros. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar la mercadería que tanta falta le hacía. Las compras Lo hará en Guaranda.

El sueño e spoder tener una casa propia y para el negocio tener bastante mercadería.

El desafío que tiene es poder darle a los hijos toda la educación. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Mayra Patricia is 25 years old, is married and has two children who are 4 and 6 years old. She lives with her husband and the children in Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar. Mayra Patricia earns her living selling men’s and women’s clothing.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothes such as pants, sweaters,t-shirts and jumpers for men and women. The loan will help her to buy the merchadise she really needs. She will buy the merchandise in Guaranda.

Her dream is to have her own house and to have a lot of merchandise for her store. The challenge she faces is to be able to give all of her children a complete education. In her free time she likes to play sport

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, sweaters, t-shirts and jumpers for men and women.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana es socia del Bancomunal Sarita, tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Se dedica a l venta de verduras en general al por mayor y menor en el mercado Nery García de Ayacucho. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal ya que con las capacitaciones que recibe aprendió a ser responsable y a no ser pesimista. Ella se siente orgullosa y mucho más emprendedora ya que en la Institución le enseñaron también a ahorrar y así ella pudo cambiar su condición económica y la de su familia. Su meta es comprar un terreno y construir su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras al por mayor para venderlas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank Sarita. She is 29 years old, is in a defacto relationship and has a son. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 5 years. She earns her living selling vegetables both wholesale and retail in the Nery Garcia Market in Ayacucho. 

She likes going to the meetings of her communal bank since the training she has received has taught her to be responsible and not to be a pessimist. She has felt proud and much more enterprising since the institution taught her to save, and in this way she can change her financial situation and that of her family.

Her goal is to buy a plot of land and to build her own house. She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables wholesale so that she can then sell them in the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale to then sell them in the market.

loans.name: Evelyn Rosina

texts.es: Evelyn es socia del Bancomunal Sarita, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años. Ella tiene una farmacia en su casa. Está agradecida con la Institución por todas las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece, le gusta participar en las reuniones de su Bancomunal ya que en ellas aprendió a ahorrar y a mejorar su condición económica. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado hasta el día de hoy. Su meta es abastecer con medicamentos a las diferentes Instituciones de salud de toda la Región Ayacucho. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de medicamentos de los diferentes laboratorios farmacéuticos para su farmacia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the communal bank Sarita. She is 32 years old, is in a de facto relationship and is the mother of 2 children. She has been working with FINCA Peru for 2 years. She has a pharmacy in her house. 

She is grateful to the institution for all the loan facilities it provides. She enjoys participating in the communal bank meetings since through these meetings she has learnt to save and to improve her financial situation. She is proud of everything she has achieved to this day. 

Her goal is to supply medicines to all the difference health institutions in the Ayacucho region. She is asking for this loan to buy medicines from various pharmaceutical laboratories for her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy medicines from various pharmaceutical laboratories for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es divorciada y tiene dos hijos  que estudian en primaria, viven en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona  San Isidro de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de accesorios para vehículos, es por eso que solicita el crédito para el aumento de capital ya que requiere comprar aceites, pisos, diesel, siliconas y todo lo que se utiliza en el área del transporte automotor, ya que es la única fuente de trabaja que tiene para mantener a sus hijos ya que debe trabajar por mas de diez horas para poder cubrir los gastos de alimentación y estudios de sus dos hijos.
El sueño que tiene Maruja es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maruja is divorced and has two children who are in elementary school. They live at her parents' house where they occupy one small room with adobe walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the District of San Isidro in the city of El Alto.

Maruja currently sells vehicle accessories. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to increase her capital for buying oil, floor mats, diesel fuel, silicone (for polishing tires), and everything else that is used on automobiles. Since this is her only source of income for supporting her children, Maruja works more than 10 hours. This enables her to pay for expenses, such as food and education for her two children.

Maruja dreams of having a house of her own so that she can provide greater comfort for her two children and improve their quality of life. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy oil, floor mats, diesel fuel, silicone, and other vehicle accessories.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en: Hoeun is just 24 years old. He has a common law relationship with his spouse, who works in the same type of business, cultivating rice for their livelihoods. This couple does not yet have a child but they wish to have one soon. Hoeun owns around 3 hectares of farmland, which provides a suitable output for the family. On the other hand, he doesn’t possess any animals for the maintenance of the rice field. As in the previous time, he usually borrows other villager’s animals or a tractor to work on his farm, and this has the effect of making much expense. To solve this problem, Hoeun decided to take out a loan from HKL to purchase two cows for farming purposes. This loan will help him to continually develop his business and he hopes to pursue a better standard of living in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for farming purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Prey Chhor district, Un is 49 years old and married. She has only one son in the family, who works in a bakery shop for pay. Un and her husband are rural farmers who have been farming for almost twenty years to make a living. As a farmer, the main challenges for her are floods and the lack of working capital to support the business. With the current business, she can earn up to 19,400 KHR per day but can save only 5,000 each day. 

This is Un's first group loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund and her group consists of two female members. They are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for farmland and spend for land preparation. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice to make a living better and save some money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland and spend for land preparation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Nimfa provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.

Nimfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy additional motor parts, and pay for maintenance and gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 60 years of age, married to Jennifer, and blessed with three children between the ages of 18 and 35 years. He owns a timber yard which he opened one year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 75,000 to purchase timber, firewood and poles. The profit from his earnings would be ploughed back to his business as well as improve the well being of his family. 

His dream is to see his business grow bigger and bigger. This is his third loan.

loans.use: To purchase timber, firewood and poles for sale in his timber yard.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is the mother of six children aged between eighteen and four years and has been in farming for eight successive years. Her farm produce includes vegetables and maize and she also runs a charcoal business to supplement her farming income.

Norah has made a loan request amounting to 41,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will help her improve her family's living standard. She plans to buy three more dairy cows in the near future.

Norah says animal diseases and floods are the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 35 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Sinacaban. Leila is married with 3 children. 

Leila has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase additional items-RTW's (clothing).

Leila has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Leila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items-RTW's (clothing)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en: Musyoki is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Musyoki will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his business. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and wheat flour

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en:
A widow in a rural area of the Dambae district, Chheng is the 43-year-old mother of three sons who are still in school. She has struggled in her life to feed her sons through planting cassava on a half hectare of farmland. Sometimes, she also works for others for pay to gain extra income to feed her family. She has been in this business for more than ten years. The main challenge for her family business is the low price of cassava products which really affects her earning to support her family, especially her children's education. With her current business, she can earn only around 8,300 KHR per day and save only around 3,000 KHR each day.

This is Chheng's first group loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund and her group consists of two female members. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to spend for land preparation for her business. She hopes to earn more income with this loan so as to keep building up some savings for her children.

loans.use: To spend for land preparation for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Aleyda Marilu

texts.es:
Aleyda, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en verduras frescas, cebollas, papas, repollo, tomates, zanahorias, tambien pan dulce, con esto estará mejorando la disponibilidad en el negocio, para poder seguir en sus ventas.
El efecto que tuvo con su préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que mejoro sus ventas, atendió más clientes; en su familia siguen igual el número de miembros, pero tiene una mayor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Aleyda is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in fresh vegetables such as onions, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, and carrots. She will also buy sweet bread so that she can improve the availability of inventory in her business and continue making sales.

Her previous loan had a positive effect. Aleyda was able to improve her sales and attend to more customers. Her family still has the same number of members, but their financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and sweet bread.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, el negocio nació hace seis meses, como un medio para subsistir con su familia, pues con esto logra cubrir los gastos familiares.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, huevos, pan, harina, condimentos, pastas, gaseosas, jugos, refrescos, de los que se pueden mencionar, porque en un negocio debe encontrarse todo los necesario para el hogar y consumo diario, este préstamo será un gran aporte para hacer más amplio el negocio.
La aspiración de Luis es que el negocio sea prospero, generándole buenas ganancias para su familia y poder realizarle mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife and four children. He manages a store that sells basic necessities. Luis started this business six months ago and it has provided the means for his family to survive. He is now able to cover the family expenses.

Luis is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as eggs, bread, flour, condiments, pastas, sodas, juices, soft drinks, and anything else that can be mentioned. His business enables him to have everything he needs for his home and his daily living. This loan will be a great help in expanding his business.

Luis aspires to prosper in his business, generate good earnings for his family, and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy eggs, bread, flour, condiments, pastas, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Carlos Remberto

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica a la crianza de pollos y a la ganadería, él vive con su madre, su esposa y un hijo, tambien con un hermano, el negocio de Carlos lo inicio hace dos años, heredado por su familia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos de engorde, esto le ayudara para fortalecer la granja, pues es su fuente de ingresos, con esto estará potenciándola a que sea más rentable y que le provea mayores ingresos. 
La aspiración de Carlos es obtener por medio del esfuerzo su propia casa, con su familia, y que su negocio sea prospero.
texts.en:
Carlos raises chickens and cattle. He lives with his mother, his wife and son, and also a brother. Carlos started in this business two years ago when he inherited it from his family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy chickens for fattening. This will help strengthen his farm, since it provides a source of income. With this loan, his business will have the potential to become more profitable and provide a better income. Carlos aspires to obtain a house of his own where he can lives with his family. He also wants his business to be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Marialita

texts.en:
Marialita is 46 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot,Tudela. She is married with 3 children. 

Marialita has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc. 

Marialita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She sells juice and ice cream from her home, selling to her neighbors. 

Rehema lives in a family house that has both electricity and piped water. She also owns some rental houses which earn her other sources of livelihood. She joined Yehu to get access to loans. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

The loan of KES 20000 will enable her start a food stall.

loans.use: start a food stall.

loans.name: Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr:
Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Elisabeth, la responsable, est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. 

Elisabeth a une baraque où elle commercialise des fripperies depuis 08 ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. 

En vue de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants, Elisabeth a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. 

Elisabeth se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two people with joint liability. Elisabeth, age 39, is the group leader and a married mother of two children who attend school. 

She has a stall where she has been selling second-hand clothing for eight years. She buys her merchandise at a market of Benin. 

To meet customer demand and provide for her children, Elisabeth is seeking a loan from Finadev. 

Elisabeth appears on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ateri Joséphine's Group

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 36 ans, Joséphine vend des divers et layettes à domicile depuis 18 ans. Elle représente un groupe de deux personnes et a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Sa clientèle est constituée de la population environnante et d'ailleurs. Elle veut participer à la scolarisation de ses cinq enfants et aider son mari dans la construction de sa boutique. C'est dans ce souci qu'elle s'est associée à sa coéquipière pour obtenir un micro crédit à Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Joséphine, aged 36, is married, and she has been selling various goods and baby clothing out of her home for eighteen years. She represents a two-person group and has a middle school education. Her customer base is composed of people in the area and elsewhere. 

Joséphine wants to help cover the cost of educating her five children and to help out her husband in building her store. With these concerns in mind, she joined her teammate to obtain a micro-loan from Finadev. 

The official is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a box of sardines, a box of milk, a box of spaghetti, and 5 dozen pieces of baby clothing

loans.name: Léontine Hinnoude's Group

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 45 ans, Léontine Hinnoude dispose d'une baraque dans laquelle elle vend de la nourriture depuis 04 ans. Elle est la responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Sa clientèle est constituée de la population environnante et d'ailleurs. Elle a le rêve de s'installer correctement et d'améliorer ses prestations. Dans le besoin de financement, Victoria Hinnoude s'est adressée avec sa coéquipière à Finadev et compte partager ses bénéfices avec sa famille pour leur bien-être. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Léontine Hinnoude, aged 45, is married, and she has a stall where she has been selling food for four years. She is the official of a two-person group. She gets her supplies at a local market. Her customer base is composed of people in the area and elsewhere. Her dream is to get set up properly and to improve her range of services. 

Needing financing, Léontine Hinnoude, along with her teammate, inquired with Finadev. She intends to share her profits with her family for their well-being. 

The official is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a box of sardines, a box of milk, a dozen of coffee, a dozen of mayonnaise, and a box of spaghetti

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Antoinette est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 16 ans. Tous vont à l'école. Elle vend des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et des divers depuis quatre ans. Antoinette s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la sous région. Sa clientèle large et diversifiée est essentiellement composée de femmes. Antoinette veut s'acheter des mèches de différentes qualités et des produits cosmétiques. Antoinette avec ses économies veut renforcer son activité et participer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants. Elle envisage agrandir son activité en vue de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en: Antoinette is married and the mother of two children. The oldest of her children is 21 and the youngest is 16, and they both go to school. Antoinette has sold hair extensions, cosmetic products and miscellaneous items for the past four years, and she gets her supplies from the markets in the sub-region. She has a large, diverse customer base, mainly comprising women. Antoinette plans to buy different kinds of hair extensions and cosmetic items. With her savings she hopes to consolidate her activity and help with her children’s professional education. In the future she plans to expand her business and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase ten dozen hair extensions of different types, two boxes of macaroni and 25 cosmetic products of different kinds.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Yeng, 25, is a married mother of an only son who is still in school and she lives in the rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. She is a rural peasant who grows rice and plants cassava and beans to make a living. She has been in this business for almost ten years. 

This is Yeng's group, consisting of four female members. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle while the rest are just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The loan has helped her improve her living and keep her son in school. Currently, she can earn up to 21,100 KHR each day to make a living. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and spend for land preparation for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living and be able to keep her son in school until graduation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and spend for land preparation for her farmland

loans.name: Gisèle's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Gisèle est responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes. Elle vit avec son mari et a deux enfants. L'aîné a 17 ans, le benjamin 11 ans et ils vont tous à l'école. Gisèle distribue depuis 16 ans de l'huile de palme et s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin. Elle est aussi sollicitée dans la vente des tissus surtout cérémoniaux. Afin de renforcer son commerce et de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Gisèle, aged 37, is the official of a two-person group. She is lives with her husband and two children. The elder is 17 years old, and the younger is 11; they both go to school. For sixteen years, Gisèle has been distributing palm oil, and she gets her supplies from the markets of Benin. She is also in demand for selling cloth, especially for ceremonies. 

To bolster her business and to meet her children's needs, Gisèle requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. The official is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy ten 10-liter containers oil, and ten lengths of cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap like used plastic, iron, tin and cans.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Agée de 36ans et mariée à un sociologue, Ayawa est mère d’un enfant âgé de 04ans qui va à l’école. Pour mieux s’épanouir et voir son enfant grandir dans de bonnes conditions, elle vend dans un marché de la place des boissons et des produits divers depuis 2001. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté principale est le manque de fonds.  Elle sollicite ce troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter de la boisson et des produits divers. Elle veut avoir une boutique au marché et assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: A 36 year old sociologist, Ayawa is a mother of a 4 year old child who attends school. In order to support herself financially and watch her child grow in good conditions, she has been selling drinks and diverse food products at the market since 2001. She stocks up on goods in Lomé, Togo, and her biggest challenge is lack of liquid funds. She is asking for her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase more products and hopefully set up a proper boutique or stall at the market in order to continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: Purchase drinks and diverse products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Sègbégnon Claire's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Sègbégnon Claire est âgée de 34 ans. Sègbègnon Claire est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui sont scolarisés et a une personne à charge. Elle est à un niveau d'instruction primaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente de nourritures depuis sept ans. Sègbégnon Claire s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de ses clients et de maximiser son profit, Sègbégnon Claire a sollicité et a obtenu, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This group consists of two people.  The group's representative, Sègbégnon Claire, is 34 years old, married, and the mother of four children who all attend school.  She has an additional person in her care.  

Sègbégnon Claire left school at the elementary school.  In order to cover her daily expenses, she has been selling food products for the past seven years.  She stocks up at a local market.

In order to satisfy her customers' demand, and to maximize her profits, Sègbégnon Claire has requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev, along with the other member of her group. Sègbégnon Claire is the woman featured on the left side of the photo.

loans.use: to buy one bag of maize, one basket of onions, one basket of tomatoes, and one box of fish.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Suzanne est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé et elle a une personne à charge. Elle vend des cartes de recharge, des sacs de charbon et des divers depuis huit ans. Suzanne s'approvisionne sur les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont composés des hommes et des femmes. Suzanne veut s'acheter des sacs de charbon, des cartons de boîte de conserve et des cartes de recharge.
texts.en: Suzanne is a married mother of one child, who is at school and for whom she is responsible. She sells refill cards, bags of coal and miscellaneous products, and has done so for the past eight years. Suzanne gets her supplies from the surrounding markets, and her customers are both male and female. Suzanne wants to buy bags of coal, boxes of canned goods and refill cards.

loans.use: To purchase one 25-liter drum of palm oil, six boxes of canned goods, six boxes of sugar and 20 refill cards.

loans.name: Afiavi Florine Romaine

texts.fr: Afiavi Florine Romain est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Le plus âgé a 05 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. Les deux vont à l'école. Coiffeuse de formation, elle associe à sa formation la  vente de mèches, de shampoing et des couches bébé depuis de 18 mois. Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché extérieur. Ses clients sont essentiellement composés des femmes. Elle veut s'acheter 50 mèches de différentes qualités, 80 shampoings et 100 couches bébé. Avec ses économies elle veut renforcer son activité et participer à l'éducation de ses enfants. Elle envisage élargir son activité afin de détenir une grande part du marché.
texts.en: Afiavi Florine Romain is married and has two children.  Her eldest child is 5 years old and her youngest is 3.  They both go to school.  Afiavi Florine Romain is a trained hairdresser.  She has also been selling hair extensions, shampoo and diapers for 18 months.  She stocks up abroad.  Her customers are mainly women.  She would like to buy 50 hair extensions of different qualities, 80 lots of shampoo and 100 lots of diapers.  With her savings, she would like to strengthen her business and contribute towards her children's education.  She plans to expand her business so that she can own a large market share.

loans.use: to buy 50 hair extensions, 80 lots of shampoo and 100 lots of diapers

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Victoire est divorcée et mère de deux enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. Les deux vont tous à l'école. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente des sacs de maïs depuis douze ans. Victoire s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle est diverse et variée. Victoire veut s'acheter des sacs de maïs. Victoire avec ses économies veut renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et contribuer au bien-être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Victoire is divorced and the mother of two children who both attend school.  Her oldest child is 15 years old, the youngest is 8.  

Victoire sells sacks of maize, an activity she has specialized in for the past twelve years.  She stocks up at markets in Benin.  Her customer base is diverse and varied.  Victoire wants to buy some sacks of maize.  With her savings, she wants to increase her turnover and contribute to her children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: Agée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de six enfants, Fatima n'a jamais été à l'école et vend du charbon et des fagots à domicile depuis 17 ans. Elle livre également des nattes, balaies et paniers aux femmes du marché. Fatima  s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Le plus âgé de ses enfants a 30 ans et le plus jeune a 16 ans. Sa clientèle est constituée des femmes du marché et d'ailleurs. Fatima prévoit aider son mari face aux besoins de leurs enfants. Ainsi dans le besoin de financement pour agrandir son commerce, Fatima a sollicité et a obternu un micro crédit à Finadev.
texts.en: Fatima is a 52 year-old married mother of six. She never attended school and has sold and delivered coal and bundles of firewood for the past 17 years. She also delivers mats, brooms and baskets to the women in the market. Fatima gets her supplies from one of the markets in the square. The oldest of her children is 30, while the youngest is 16. Her customers are women from the market and the surrounding area. Fatima plans to help her husband with their children's needs. Thus, because she needed financial support to expand her business, Fatima requested and received a microloan from Finadev.

loans.use: to purchase 10 mats, 10 baskets, 10 brooms and 25 fans.

loans.name: Ida Toli

texts.fr: Ida Toli est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 12 ans. Les trois vont tous à l'école. Elle vend des sacs de  maïs depuis sept mois. Ida Toli s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la place. Sa clientèle est composée de femmes. Ida Toli veut s'acheter des sacs de maïs. Ida Toli avec ses économies veut renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et accroître son revenu supplémentaire.
texts.en: Ida Toli is married with three children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest 13 years old. All three go to school. She has been selling sacks of corn for seven months. Ida Toli buys her stock at the local markets. Her customers are women. Ida Toli wants to buy some sacks of corn. With her savings she wants to improve her purchasing capacity and increase her additional income.

loans.use: to buy 14 sacks of corn,1 box of canned food and 2 boxes of washing powder.

loans.name: Noussiratou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Noussiratou est âgée de 49 ans. Noussiratou est mariée et a trois enfants qui sont scolarisés. Elle est a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente de gaz Oryx et de divers depuis neuf ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, Noussiratou sollicite, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group has two members and is represented by Noussiratou, who is 49 years of age. She is married and a mother to three children, who are all at school. She herself went to high school. To cover her daily expenses she works selling Oryx gas and miscellaneous articles, and has done so for nine years. She obtains her supplies from a market in Benin. To meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, Noussiratou has requested a microloan from Finadev, along with the other member of the team. Noussiratou is pictured to the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy eight Oryx gas cylinders.

loans.name: Astride Corine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du groupe du nom d'Astride Corine est âgée de 31 ans. Astride Corine est mariée et mère de deux enfants qui sont scolarisés. Elle est à un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente de divers, liqueurs, gari, riz et autres articles depuis deux ans. Astride Corine s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la place. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de répondre aux exigences de ses clients, Astride Corine a sollicité et a obtenu, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group is made up of two people. The representative of the group who is named Astride Corine is 31 years old. Astride Corine is married with two children who go to school. She attained a secondary education level. To assume daily expenses, she has sold various products such as liquor, gari (young marinated ginger), rice and other articles for the last two years. Astride Corine buys her supplies at the local markets. With a view to expanding her business and satisfying the demands of her customers, Astride Corine and her team-mate have requested and obtained a micro credit from Finadev.The person in charge is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of liquor and 2 cartons of milk.

loans.name: Sessi Nathalie

texts.fr: Sessi Nathalie est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mère d'une fille scolarisée qui a 5 ans. Avec son niveau d'instruction secondaire, Sessi Nathalie s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers, pommes de terre, oignons et chaussures qu'elle s'approprie dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur depuis 07 ans. Ses clients sont constitués de femmes de sa ville, de son quartier puisqu'elle vend à domicile et en distribue aussi. Soucieuse de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sessi Nathalie a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Elle aimerait participer à l'avenir de sa fille et ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Sessi Nathalie is 37 years old and the mother of a 5-year-old girl, who goes to school. Having a middle school education, Sessi Nathalie became specialized in selling a variety of goods: potatoes, onions, and shoes that she acquires from a market in Benin and from abroad. She has been in this business for seven years. Her customer base is composed of women from her city and her district, since she sells from her home and also distributes her goods. 

Concerned about satisfying the customer demand, Sessi Nathalie requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. She would like to help her daughter's future, and her ambition is to open a large store.

loans.use: to buy a box of soap, a box of spaghetti, a box of sardines, a box of milk, a sack of rice, 2 dozen shoes, a sack of onions, and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Eriyomi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Eriyomi est âgée de 26 ans. Eriyomi est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Youssouf. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Eriyomi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Eriyomi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Eriyomi vend du des colliers et des produits pour cheveux. Eriyomi vend aussi de façon secondaire des sacs et des tissus par le système de distribution depuis près de cinq ans. Eriyomi s’approvisionne à Lomé. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Eriyomi désire obtenir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The DJROMAHUTON group is comprised of three female friends. The representative of the group, named Eriyomi, can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. This is the second time that the group is asking for a loan from ALIDé in order to increase the level of activity of their business. Eriyomi is 26 years old and married to a blacksmith named Youssouf. Le couple have two children that they care for, one of whom attends school. Eriyomi never attended school, and shares the responsibility of the family expenses along with her husband. For the past 5 years she has been selling necklaces and hair products principally, as well as bags and cloth through distribution channels. The group stocks up on products in Lomé and is asking for a second loan from ALIDé in order to stock up on more goods and better respond to the demands of her customers. The previous credit was successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs, des tissuset des produits de cheveux.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, vive con su esposa y dos hijas, su familia le ayuda a atender el negocio, este surgió por el apoyo de su esposa, trabaja todos los días, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para surtir el negocio, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, esta compra le permitirá incrementar la mercadería en el negocio, para ofrecer mayor variedad a los clientes.
La aspiración de José es crecer en el negocio, aumentar su clientela y apoyar a su familia para que cuenten con lo necesario.
texts.en:
José manages a shop that sells household goods. He lives with his wife and two daughters. His family helps him out in the shop, which started with the support of his wife. José works every day, without a fixed schedule.

He is requesting a loan to buy products to stock up his business: rice, beans, sugar and oil. This purchase will allow him to increase the goods in his shop and offer greater choice to his customers.

José's aspiration is to grow the business, increase his clientele and support his family to provide them with the basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy some basic goods: rice, beans, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is married with eight children, four of whom go to school. She has owned a retail shop for one year. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, salt, soap and bread for her shop. Besides her retail business, Gertrude gets additional income through renting out rooms. She sells retail goods to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of commodities and seasonality. She aspires to see her business expand into the wholesale area and also to educate her children to university-level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 
Gina has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has been in this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
Gina has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for almost a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of cosmetics products such as powder, make-up and eye liner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Lila Estani

texts.es:
Lila es una mujer  de 56 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad no viven con ella. Vive en casa propia con su cónyuge, En la parte rural del distrito de Motupe. Además solo cuentan con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de pozo tubular (agua del subsuelo); la mayoría de la población viven bajo estas circunstancias.

La actividad principal que desarrolla Lila es la venta de productos de belleza (cosméticos), este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su propio domicilio y cuenta con clientes ya establecidos, además esta actividad la realiza desde hace  10  años, lo que le ha permitido en el tiempo tener experiencia en este tipo de negocio. 

El monto del crédito otorgado será de S/. 2000 nuevos soles y será para incrementar su capital de trabajo (compra de productos de belleza), es decir ella quiere aprovechar las fiestas por el día de la madre, para que de esa manera pueda tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona.
texts.en:
Lila is a 56 years old.  She has three children, all of whom are grown up and no longer live with her. She lives in her own house with her spouse, in the rural part of the Motupe district. They only have a basic electricity service and they have to fetch water from a bore-hole (ground water). The majority of the population lives in these conditions.

Lila's main business activity is selling beauty products (cosmetics). She runs this business from her home and has a well established clientele. She started this business 10 years ago, so she is now very experienced.  

The amount of credit granted will be 2000 PEN and will be used to increase her working capital (purchase of beauty products). Lila wants to take advantage of the Mother's Day holiday, to increase the income for her household and thus improve their quality of life. As far as beauty products are concerned, there is no real competition in the area.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is widowed with two children who are now working. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.
Mary Grace operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend money on cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1500 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Mary Grace dreams of seeing her children succeed in their chosen careers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional materials for fishing, such as fishing nets, and to maintain and buy gasoline for the engine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar is 59 years old and is married with four children. She lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang province.
