Sar dedicates herself to the operation of her rice farming business. She has been in this business for nearly 33 years. She normally grows her rice crops twice a year because she owns a few plots of farmland, which are located not too far from the province's water supplies. Sar has a husband, a supportive man, who helps manage the maintenance of the rice field. Due to her need of sufficient capital to improve this business, Sar is now looking for a loan of USD $600 to purchase rice seeds and rent a tractor to till her land. 
In the future, Sar would like to save some of her income to renovate her house and create a reserve for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and rend a tractor to till her land.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Angelita hopes to increase her income so she can provide for the basic needs of her family and sustain her children's education. She also hopes to have sufficient capital to expand her farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
This is Mylene, 35, resident of Caloocan City. She is married to Leo. She has three children; one is in elementary level and two are not yet sent to school. By the grace of God, she’s still able to send one of her children to school and still hoping that the child will be able to make it to college.

Mylene operates a variety store where she stocks some supplies that are commonly bought by the neighborhood. She also has a food stall where one can buy home-cooked meals. Her variety store and food stall make it easy for her neighbors to buy supplies and food for their house without the need to travel long distances. 

To help her continue the operations for her variety store, she is requesting a loan of Php34,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her variety store. 

She’s hoping that this additional capital for her business will help her expand her business more and through her hard work, send all her children to finish college. She faithfully meets up with her CCT-fellowship members to share stories of her business every week.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her variety store business.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy household necessities such as food and beverages to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages and more new products for selling in her general store.

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Be is requesting a new loan to buy fabrics and clothing materials to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong would like to take a further loan to buy more materials and fabrics to meet her customers' demand. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana con su anterior credikiva,  invirtió en la compra de materias primas e insumos, además compró utensilios que son indispensables para la buena  manipulación de los alimentos y hacen más eficiente su labor. En la actualidad se prepara  para recibir u nuevo credikiva,  porque comprará en mayor cantidad maíz y también como produce pasteles, invertirá en carne, papa y verduras. Así mismo comprará frutas de cosecha para la venta al detalle y muy seguramente tendrá éxito porque cuenta con  una clientela acreditada, sabe mucho escoger los productos alimenticios que compra y la hace en una temporada en la cual se incrementan las ventas, como lo son las fiestas familiares y religiosas que se acercan, como el día de las madres. Estoy muy agradecida con esta Fundación, por ayudarme en este negocio que actualmente tengo, con el apoyo a ustedes he salido adelante y no he prestado a más gente particular.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Ana bought raw materials and supplies, and also bought cooking utensils which are indispensable to the safe handling of food and which allow her to work more efficiently. 

At the moment she is preparing to receive another Kiva loan. She will buy a larger quantity of corn and she will buy meat, potatoes and vegetables to make pastries. She will also buy seasonal fruits to resell.

She is very likely to succeed in her business because she has long-term customers, she knows how to choose good food products, and she increases the amount she buys during busy seasons, such as when family celebrations or religious festivals are approaching, for example mother’s day. 

She says she “is very grateful to Fundacion, for helping me with the business I now have, with your help I have been able to get ahead and have not borrowed from private lenders.”

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of corn and to buy meat, potatoes and vegetables to make pastries. She will also buy seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para iniciar su trabajo agrícola, con este préstamo comprara abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada de maíz, y así comenzar tan ardua labor, esperando que sea exitoso, que pueda producir una buena cosecha.
El efecto que ha tenido con el préstamo anterior es que aumento la productividad, que le permitió generar ganancias para su familia, ha mejorado actualmente su condición de familia.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan to start her agricultural work. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and improved corn seed, and thus she can begin the hard work, hoping that she is successful and can produce a good harvest.

With the previous loan, María was able to increase her productivity, and thus make a profit for her family. Her family's living conditions have now improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and improved corn seed.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 56 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. She has children who still go to school. Corazon has been practicing farming for 12 years. She grows rice crops to sell to her community. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP from farming. Her income goes to her family's basic needs and school expenses. She works hard to increase her earnings and sustain her children's education. She asked for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang would like to take a further loan to buy more varieties of milk tea to sell at her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many varieties of milk tea to sell

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 53-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn money through a business of making iron springs. They started this business thirty years ago. 

He intends to take a loan to buy materials and equipment to increase his production of springs. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the orders of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment to increase his production of springs.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque está en proceso de la siembra de maíz y chile, para esto deberá comprase lo necesario como semilla mejorada de maíz, 1500 plantas de chile, abono y foliares, esto le ayudara para realizar la siembra y que esta pueda ser productiva.
Con el préstamo anterior, Víctor tuvo una buena experiencia, pues logro aumentar la producción, vendió y tambien alimento a su familia, en la actualidad está muy bien, tanto con su familia como en lo económico.
texts.en:
Victor is requesting a new loan because he is in the process of planting corn and chili peppers. For this, he needs to buy the necessities, such as improved corn seed, 1500 chili pepper plants, fertilizer and foliar insecticides. This will help to make the sowing productive.

Victor had a good experience with the previous loan, as he was able to increase production and sales, and provide food for his family. He is currently doing very well, as are his family and his economic situation.

loans.use: to buy improved corn seed, 1500 chili pepper plants, fertilizer and foliar insecticides.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 42, resident of Miramonte Park East, Tala, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Juan who is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). She has three children who are high-school and elementary level.  Regina is working hard to provide food for the family. She dreams that one day, her small variety store could be a bigger grocery store to help them better in their financial needs.

Regina operates a small variety store and also sells rice cakes and frozen meat. She gets an income average of Php500 per day. 

To help her continue the operations for her small variety store, and selling rice cakes and frozen meat, she is requesting Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more supplies for her small variety store as well as to buy more rice cakes and frozen meat.

She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and that this would be one step for her dream that her small variety store will someday be a bigger grocery store.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her variety store, and to buy more rice cakes and frozen meat.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new accessories and phone cards for selling at her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Edgar Vitervo

texts.es:
EDGAR VITERVO tiene 60 años de edad es casaso no tiene hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

EDGAR VITERVO tiene un bus y da servicio a la comunidad. 

Soliicta el crédito para poder comprar repustos para el bus cómo eje, balbula, espejo retrovisor y llantas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los repuestos que tanta falta le hacía. 

Las compras lo hará en Guaranda.

El sueño es poder cambiar de casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edgar Vitervo is 60 years old, married, no children. He lives in Guaranda in the Bolívar province.

He has a bus and provides service to the community. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to buy spare parts for the bus, such as a shaft, valves, a rear-view mirror and tires.

With the help of this loan he can buy these much-needed spare parts.  

He will buy them in Guaranda.

Edgar Vitervo's dream is to be able to move house. In his free time, he likes to read and do sport.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the bus, such as a shaft, valves, a rear-view mirror and tires.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi, 53, is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business fifteen years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yoghurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupe de deux personnes, Christine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle vend à domicile depuis vingt ans les articles tels que les cartes de recharge, du charbon, de l'huiles et autres. Pour l'approvisionnement des cartes, Christine se dirige dans les points de vente le plus proche et pour le reste, elle se rapproche de ses livreurs. Afin de renforcer son commerce et de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants, Christine a sollicité, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: Christine, who is in charge of the group of two people, is married and mother to four children. She has been selling articles such as recharge cards, charcoal, oil etc.. for the past 20 years. To get fresh supplies of cards, she goes to the nearest points of sale and, as far as the other items are concerned she goes to her delivery men/women. In order to strengthen her business and provide for her children's needs, Christine has requested a microcredit from Finadev, together with the other group member. She is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal, five 10 liter containers of groundnut oil and a total of 50,000FCFA of all types of recharge cards.

loans.name: Théole Sidonie's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Théole Sidonie est responsable du groupe de deux personnes. Elle est  mariée et mère de quatre enfants  dont trois scolarisés. Elle vend de la friperie dans sa boutique depuis 20 ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle est constituée de personnes de tout sexe et de tout âge. Théole Sidonie a sollicité, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un crédit auprès de Finadev. Elle ambitionne faire de l'épargne et mener à bien son activité. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: Théole Sidonie is 39 years old and responsible for this group of two people. She is married and mother to four children, three of whom are at school. She has been selling second-hand clothing in her shop for the past 20 years and gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Her customer base is made up of both men and women of all ages. Théole Sidonie has requested a loan from Finadev, together with the other group member. Her ambition is to save money and do well in her business. She is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy two bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Cristian Antonio

texts.es:
Cristian, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, pues está en la temporada donde inicia sus labores en la agricultura, comprara abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, para iniciar a limpiar el terreno y poder sembrar granos básicos.
El manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le permitió tener una buena crianza de cerdos, con la cual cambiaron algunas circunstancias en la familia, pues le beneficio para la alimentación y generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Cristian is requesting a new loan to invest in his business. He is currently in the season in which his agricultural work begins so he will buy fertiliser, insecticides and pesticides in order to begin clearing his plot of land and sowing basic seeds. 

He confirms that his previous loan had a positive impact, allowing him to rear a good number of pigs. This brought changes to his family's situation, improving their diet and generating income.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, insecticides and pesticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is 58 years old and is widowed. She lives with her two children, one son and one daughter, in Ho Chi Minh city. For over 12 years, she has been running a food stall to sell beef noodles and breads for her customers in the local community. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

Minh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food such as noodles and soup to sell at her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more food such as noodles and soup to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Alicia tiene 58 años y es casada con 2 hijos que ya son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de helados de manera ambulante ya que ambula por los distintos colegios, plazas y canchas de futbol, ella vive en la zona de Bajo Llojeta, Este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución,  Alicia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de un carrito para la venta de helados, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo y también   mejorar la imagen de su negocio, la Sra.  Alicia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son expandir su negocio y va utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la distribución de sus productos. Su deseo para su negocio es ampliar mucho mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia is 58 years old and is married with 2 children who have now left home. She works as a street vendor selling ice creams at different schools, squares and football pitches. She lives in the Bajo Llojeta area. 

This loan is her fourth cycle within the institution. Alicia will use the loan to buy a cart to sell her ice creams. She's requesting this loan due to her lack of capital and in order to improve the image of her business. Alicia faces the challenge of expanding her business, and she will use the profits to improve the distribution of her products. Her desire is to expand her business much more widely.

loans.use: to buy a cart to sell ice creams.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine is 33 years old and married with three children between the ages of three and nine. She purchases various goods such as tomatoes, small fish, aubergine, etc., and has three years of experience in this work. Her business is open from 9 a.m to 6 p.m every day except on Sunday.

Albertine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as tomatoes, small fish, aubergine, etc., for re-sale. With any profit she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as tomatoes, small fish, aubergine, etc., for re-sale.

loans.name: Dolores De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Dolores habitante del departamento de Granada es comerciante se dedica a la producción y venta de Nacatamales desde hace 20 años, soltera, realizo estudio hasta la primaria. Ella inicia  esta actividad desde muy jovencita ayudándole a su abuelita ya que fue quien empezó con el negocio en el que fue aprendiendo, luego decide independizarse empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta en la venta de nacatamales donde actualmente recibe  el apoyo de su abuelita que la supervisa para darle el sabor y una joven que le ayuda en la elaboración del producto, después que Dolores tiene listo los nacatamales sale a venderlos en los alrededores de la comunidad los días sábados y domingo. 
Cuenta con otros ingresos pues también sale a vender frutas y verduras tales como jocote, tamarindo, aguacate en las diferentes épocas de cosecha. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar masa, carne, tomate, etc, todos los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los nacatamales, ella estima que el crédito le ayudara porque podrá aumentar sus ventas generándole mayores ganancias y podrá mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, sus metas próximas es seguir trabajando con el apoyo de prestamos para introducir mas productos de las cosecha en el mercado  con el objetivo de obtener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores lives in the department of Granada. She is a shopkeeper and has been producing and selling 'nacatamales' (steamed meat and vegetable pasties) for 20 years. She is single and completed primary school. She began this activity at a very young age, helping her grandmother who started up the business in which she learnt the trade. Later on, she decided to become independent and she began to work in her own business selling 'nacatamales'. She currently receives the support of her grandmother who supervises her to give the flavour, and a young girl who helps her to make the products. When Dolores has the 'nacatamales' ready, she goes out to sell them in the area surrounding the community on Saturdays and Sundays.   
 
Dolores has other sources of income as she also goes out to sell fruit and vegetables such as jocotes, tamarinds and avocadoes according to the harvest. She is requesting the loan to invest in pastry, meat, tomatoes, etc. - all the ingredients necessary to make 'nacatamales'. She says that the credit will help her because she will be able to increase her sales, bringing her a higher income and allowing her to improve the infrastructure of her house. Her next objective is to carry on working with the help of loans to introduce more products from the harvest into the market with the aim of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pastry, meat, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Nu

texts.en:
Nu is 49 years old and widowed. She lives with her son in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She makes money to raise her son and cover all family expenses through a business of washing clothes.

She started her business five years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying a washing machine that will help her to increase her washing capacity and her income. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is aged thirty-nine years and married with six children; five of whom are in school. She has had eight straight years in farming and currently produces milk and maize for the local market. 

Salina has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes the acquisition of an additional dairy cow will help her improve her dairy farming business and income in general. She is focusing on having four dairy cows.

She says the high cost of feeds is the major challenge in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung, 31, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker in a fatory in an industrial zone.

He has been running a metal shop in front of his house for three years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more iron pieces to increase his production of custom-made metal parts.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy more iron pieces to increase his production of metal parts.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine has been in farming for five consecutive years and produces milk and eggs from her dairy and poultry farming businesses. She sells the products to the local market. She is married with three children aged  between ten and five years.

Mourine has made a second loan request with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 52,000 KES and hopes she will be able to generate enough income to meet family needs as well as to provide the family milk for daily consumption. She plans to grow the dairy business to be her core farming activity.

She is however worried about the challenge of dairy animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong, 48 years old, is married and has three children; two daughters and one son. Cuong and his wife support their family through the income they earn from cleaning, sorting and preparing spring onion bulbs. They have run this business for five years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Cuong intends to take a loan to increase his working capital for his current business by buying a larger quantity of onion bulbs to process and resell. The additional capital will enable him to increase his production and sales. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of onion bulbs to process and resell.

loans.name: Quang

texts.en:
Quang, 34, is married and has a daughter. He lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker at a factory in the local community. He supports his family by running a shop at his house to make different kinds of iron products such as screws and hinges. 

He started this business four years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity of iron pieces to increase his production.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of iron pieces to increase his production of iron products such as screws and hinges.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina, aged 44, is a married mother of five children, a few of whom are still in school. She lives in a rural area located in the Mongkol Borey district and earns a living through planting rice and vegetables. She sometimes supplements the family's income by working for others for pay. She has been in this business for twenty-two years. 

This is Sina's group loan which consists of three female members. She has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while the other two members have been with VisionFund for from three to five loan cycles. She completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. Currently, she can earn up to 28,000 KHR from her current source of income to support her family. 

Now leading the group to apply for another loan with VisionFund, Sina, who is the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to spend on land preparation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and earn more income to support her family and her children's studies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and to spend on land preparation.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is 41 years old and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife helps him run a food stall in front of their house. He sells sweetened porridge for the people in his community. He has run this business for twenty years. He started this business to cover his expenses and raise his two children.

Hung is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying ingredients to make more kinds of porridge and sweets, and he also would like to use part of the loan to repair his house. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make more kinds of porridge and sweets and also to repair his house.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is a 22-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents in Ho Chi Minh City. For five years she has run a business of selling schoolbags to people in her community.

Ngan would like a loan to increase her business capital and purchase better quality schoolbags at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy better quality schoolbags to sell to people in her community.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is 56 years old and is single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has run a food stall in her community for two years. She sells meals, noodles and soup for breakfast for people in the local area. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of quality food and ingredients to make better food for selling.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and also to save money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of quality food and ingredients to make better food for selling.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 52-year-old farmer from the Martvili District. She lives with her husband, Gia, and her mother in law (a pensioner). Gia works as a car mechanic in the village. He repairs cars of his and nearby villages’ population. Mzia runs the agricultural business of the family. In particular, she takes care of two milk cows, producing cheese and selling it from houses to local dairy products retailers. Also, Mzia and Gia grow maize on a family-owned 2-hectare plot of land. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including the monthly pension of Mzia’s mother in law.

Mzia requested credit for a start-up trade with secondhand clothes. She will purchase the clothes from wholesalers and sell it in the village with a price mark-up. According to her estimations, the business will be profitable, as there is quite a big demand for cheap clothing in the village, and also she won’t have competitors. Mzia plans to make some savings in order to purchase a car, in order to sell the clothes in other villages as well from the car.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing for resale in the village.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is 39 years old and is married. He and his wife have been making plaster molds to sell for twenty years. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Minh is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more raw materials to increase his production of plaster molds. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities, and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to increase his production of molds.

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en:
Phuc is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater range and quantity of goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Giao

texts.en:
Giao is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a labourer. For three years, she has run a general store to sell milk, souvenirs, personal use items and necessary household products to people in her community.

Giao would like a loan to purchase more souvenirs to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase sourvenirs for selling at her store.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients to make many kinds of cakes to sell at her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of cakes. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good ingredients to make many kinds of cakes for selling at her store.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para su negocio, comprándose refrescos de varios sabores y gaseosas, esto le ayudara para aumentar su inventario y tener mayor disponibilidad al momento de atender a sus clientes.
El con el préstamo anterior logro fortalecer el negocio, haciendo mas rentable, incremento sus ventas y la clientela, sus condiciones económicas han cambiado, ha solventado algunas necesidades básicas de su familia,
texts.en:
Joel is requesting a new loan for his business in order to buy soft drinks in various flavours, and sodas. This will help him to increase his inventory and to have a greater availability when he serves his customers.

With the previous loan, he managed to strengthen his business making it more profitable by increasing his sales and customer base. His economic situation has now changed, and he has settled some of his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and sodas.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en: Kazungu is applying for his second loan of KES 70,000 to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil, and maize flour to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking flour, cooking oil, soft drinks  and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: C 8937 Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Nyirantore is 47 years old and is married with five children. She is the leader of a group that is called "C 8937 ABANYAMURAVA" in the local language. Nyirantore (pictured at the back, on the right) has 10 years of experience selling various goods such as cooking oil and cassava. Her business is well-organized and is open from 7 am to 6 pm every day, except on Sundays. 

Nyirantore has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods to sell, such as cooking oil and cassava. With any profit she makes, she will be able to save for her future and to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell, such as cooking oil and cassava

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is thirty-one years old. A business lady, she is married to Joseph who is a business man. They are blessed with three children aged fifteen, eight and four. She has been in a livestock trading business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES. 5,500 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD ,after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Pauline will use the loan to purchase more goats, sheep and cows to trade. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a pick up for transporting livestock to different nearby markets.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, sheep and cows to trade.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a twenty-eight-year old business man. He is married to Lucy who is a business lady. They are blessed with two children aged nine and three. He has been running a retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 12,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Anthony will use the loan to purchase stock for his shop like sugar, rice and maize meal. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop which will help him to cater for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop like sugar, rice and maize meal.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married fifty-two-year-old business lady. She and her husband are blessed with two children. She has been keeping rabbits for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Faith will use the loan to buy more rabbits to rear and animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export the rabbits.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits and animal feed.

loans.name: Celso Noel

texts.es:
Celso, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de repuestos y herramientas para su taller de bicicletas, comprándose llantas, tubos, parches, bombas, esto le ayudara para tener lo necesario y poder realizar los trabajos de los clientes.
Con su préstamo anterior tuvo una buena experiencia, pues con la inversión mejoro su calidad de trabajo, atendió mejor a los cliente, sus ingresos familiares fueron mejor.
texts.en:
Celso is requesting a new loan so that he can buy spare parts and tools for his bicycle repair workshop, including tires, inner tubes, patches and pumps. This will help him to have the necessary supplies to be able to carry out work for his customers. 

He had a good experience with his first loan, as with the investment he was able to improve the quality of his work, serve his customers better and increase his household income.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes, patches and pumps.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a forty-five-year-old business lady. She is married to Stephen who is also a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been a tailor for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 19,500 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Agnes will use the loan to purchase cloth and sewing threads. 

She will also buy a sewing machine. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing threads.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is requesting a new loan to buy materials for her husband's shoe-making business and to buy some new basic products and food to sell in her general store. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoes, as well as food and other products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is a mother and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and has been in active farming for seven years. Her farm produces tomatoes and cabbages for the local market. She is married with five children who are all schooling.

Wilter has made a second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will help in providing the family with milk for daily consumption as well as additional income to meet other family needs. She adds her hotel business which she runs to supplement her farming income will also do better due to availability of cheaper milk from her own farm.

She however points out at animal diseases and occasional droughts as the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has two children.  

She runs a grocery business to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She also does farming to supplement her income.  

She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business and employ people. 

She has requested 50,000 KES to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is married and has four children.  

She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for only one year. She also does farming to supplement her income.  

She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.
  
She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  

She has requested  20,000 KES to buy soda, maize flour and cereals.

loans.use: To buy soda, maize flour and cereals.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a twenty-six-year-old business lady who is married and has one child. She has been keeping rabbits for the past two years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to cater for her family’s basic needs.

Joyce will use the loan to buy more rabbits and animal feeds. She will also build a rabbit hutch. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to own a rabbit farm and export the rabbits which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits and their feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old, married to Mike, and blessed with children. She owns a boutique, a business she started 26 years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase jeans trousers for sale.

The profit she earns from it will help her add more stock to her business. Her dream is to expand her business into a wholesale. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase jeans trousers for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a fifty-year-old married business lady. She and her husband are blessed with two children. She has been keeping rabbits for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES. 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Jane will use the loan to buy more rabbits and their feed. She will also build a rabbit hutch. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children and boost the rabbit business.

Her hopes and dreams are to own a rabbit farm and to export the rabbits.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits and animal feed.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has two children.  

She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years. She also does farming to supplement her income.  

She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She has also learned how to save her money.

She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested 63,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and sweets.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and sweets.

loans.name: Maxon

texts.en:
Maxon is twenty-five years old, married and the father of one child. For the last year, he has earned a living by hawking goods in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his second loan, for KES 40,000, to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, biscuits, hair combs, mirrors and so on to sell to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, hair combs and mirrors to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani lives in Tskaltubo District. She is fifty-three years old and is a widow. Nani lives with her big family: her thirty-two-year-old daughter, her son-in-law, mother-in-law and two grandchildren. Her grandson works as driver in a local company. Nani leads the agricultural business of the family. She has four milk cows. Nani produces on average 80 kg of cheese per month. She sells it on Tskaltubo open market to local dairy products retailers. Along with the above mentioned the family owns a vineyard with 500 vines. Nani and her son in law produce wine and sell it on the same market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris, including the pension of Nani’s mother-in-law. 

Nani requested credit to purchase bulls. Nani will take wood from the forest with the assistance of the bulls. She will sell the wood in the village. The people in the village use the wood to heat the oven during winter months, as it is the only way of heating the house. 

The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bulls.

loans.name: Tereziah

texts.en:
Tereziah is 31 years old, married and has two children.  

She runs a grocery business to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because has been trained on business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old married to Aggrey, and they are blessed with two children, age 18 and 14 years. 

She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she started three years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale. The anticipated profit will help her buy additional stock for her business. 

Her dream is to see herself prosper in her business as well as work hard and repay her loan on time. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, 30, drives a taxi and thus he provides for his family. Davit lives in Vanadzor but he drives his taxi not only in the Vanadzor city area but also he drives his passengers to the Armenian capital, Yerevan, and to Georgia as well. The main part of Davit’s passengers who travel long distances are sellers, who buy merchandise from Yerevan and different cities of Georgia. Those sellers now are Davit’s regular passengers as Davit always drives his passengers safely and with care.
 
Davit lives with his parents, who are unemployed, so Davit’s business is the only source of income for them. 

Davit wants to reduce his business’s expenditures, so he is asking for a 300,000 AMD loan to convert his vehicle engine to work on CNG (compressed natural gas), as CNG is cheaper and also eco friendly in comparison with petrol.
  
This is Davit’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle engine to work on CNG (compressed natural gas).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 62 years old and a farmer. She is married to John, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. 

She has been keeping pigs for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by KADET staff. Mary will use the loan to buy pigs and animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a poultry farm, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal  feed.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of fruit, ingredients for food making and food packages. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers good quality food. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food packages, many kinds of fruit and ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is twenty-nine years old and is married with one child who is two years old. He sells sorghum in sacks and he has been in this business for two years. 

Eric has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantities of sorghum in sacks for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantities of sorghum in sacks to re-sell.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is requesting a new loan to buy food and beverages to sell on her food stall. In addition, she  would like to use a part of this loan to buy a scooter for her working transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality food and beverages for her food stall and a scooter for transportation.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut would like to take a further loan to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is fifty-four years old and is married with four children aged between six and twenty-eight years old. He sells various goods such as cooking oil, soap, salt, rice, lotions etc. 

Anastase has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, soap, salt, rice, lotions etc to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, soap, salt, rice and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is thirty-nine years old and is married with four children aged between five and thirteen. He also takes care of six relatives. He sells beans, vegetables etc. 

Evariste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate more beans, vegetables etc to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business. Evariste also hopes to build his own house.

loans.use: To cultivate more beans and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 49-year-old farmer from Martkopi in the Gardabani District of east Georgia. He lives with his family: his wife Tamara, two adult children (26 and 24 years old), his daughter-in-law and his mother (a pensioner). Tamara works as teacher in a local school. His son works as a policeman and his daughter is a nurse in a local hospital. Alex runs the dairy farm owned by the family. He takes care of two milk cows and produces on average 40 kg of cheese per month, which is sold from the family home to local dairy product retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 laris. 

Alex has requested a loan for purchasing calves. He will rear them in the cattle shed located in his yard and in 6-7 months he will sell the grown calves for a profit. Alex will reinvest this into the same business and purchase more calves to repeat the process again. This business venture will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Prisilah

texts.en:
Prisilah is married and has four children.  

She runs a grocery business to earn a living. She has been in the business for over ten years. She also sells tea leaves to supplement her income.  

She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.
  
She hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy cabbages, onions, bananas and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions, bananas and tomatoes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is forty years old. A business man, he is married to Elizabeth who is a business woman. They are blessed with two children aged twelve and three. 

He has been distributing cakes for the past four years with a monthly income of KES10,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by a staff member. 

George will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil for baking cakes. He will also buy a bicycle for distributing cakes. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil for baking cakes.

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en: Uyen would like to take a further loan to buy food packages and a scooter for working transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food packages and a scooter.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is requesting a new loan to buy good quality rice and repair her food stall. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her food stall and buy good quality rice in bulk for her food stall.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of cakes and beverages to sell at her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of food. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell.

loans.name: C 9458 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is thirty-four years old and is married with four children aged between three and ten. She is the leader of a group which called "C 9458 ABUNZUBUMWE" in the local language. 

Jacqueline (with the hand raised) has two years of experience selling various goods such as cooking oil, soap, biscuits, sugar etc. Her business is well-organized and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, soap, biscuits, sugar etc to sell. With any profit, she will be able to save for the future and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, soap, biscuits and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is fifty-two years old. A business lady, she is a widowed with three children aged twenty-five, twenty-one and seventeen. She has been in the livestock trading business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 19,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Rose will use the loan to buy more cows, goats and sheep to trade. She will also buy animal feed. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children up to university level. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a pick-up for transporting livestock to nearby market.

loans.use: to buy more cows, goats and sheep to trade.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is thirty-three years old and is married with four children aged between three and twelve. He also takes care of five relatives. He sells meat and he has been in this business for three years. 

Anastase has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of meat to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of meat to sell.

loans.name: Jean D`amour

texts.en:
Jean d`Amour is thirty-one years old and is married with three children aged between one and twelve. He sells various goods such as cooking oil, soap, pens, plastic shoes etc and he has been in this business for two years.

Jean d`Amour has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, soap, pens, plastic shoes etc to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, soap, pens and plastic shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rowland

texts.en:
Rowland is aged fifty-seven and carries out farming in his rural area of Kitale area in Western Kenya. He has been in active farming for the last ten years. He is married with twelve children, five of whom are still schooling.

Rowland has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of a dairy cow will help him provide his family with basic needs. He also plans to buy a milling machine for processing cereals.

He says the challenge is animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is forty-two years old and is married with five children aged between five and sixteen. He also takes care of six relatives. He sells bananas and he has ten years of experience in this business. 

Leonidas has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate more bananas to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To cultivate more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy rice, bran and many kind of products to sell in her store. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, bran and many kind of products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice, paraffin and maize flour. With the additional stock, she earned more profits from her business. She hopes to expand her shop into wholesale in the future. 

She has requested a new loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes because she wants to start a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a hard-working businesslady. She sells fish to earn a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business and employ people. Mary has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 50 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old, and he takes care of 4 relatives. 

Gaspard sells meat. He currently employs one person to help him, and he has three years of experience in this line of work.

Gaspard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of meat for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of meat for resale.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao would like to take another loan to purchase foodstuffs, different cages, and related supplies for birds and pets. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. Thao also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, cages, and other supplies for birds and pets.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with eight children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren and in-laws). She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Hadjah has a business selling beer and local gin. She has been in this business for the last 5 years and she sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.  

Hadjah doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow large enough that she can run a fully stocked pub.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a farmer the in Kitale area of Western Kenya where she lives with her family of five children who are  between thirteen and one year of age. Her farm produces maize and poultry products for the local local market.

Judith has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She plans to have  not less than three dairy cows in the future.

Judith plans to pay the loan in time in order to be eligible for more loans.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Patricia Rufina

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia tiene 29 años se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir, ella está sacando crédito por segunda vez en nuestra institución, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. Patricia demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, La Sra. Patricia, vive en la zona villa nueva Potosí, de la ciudad de la Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con su esposo, ambos trabajan confeccionando chamarras y buzos deportivos ya hace unos 10 años, la Sra. Patricia, saco este crédito para la de telas para surtir su taller y entregar un importante pedido, él taller está ubicado en la casa de sus papás, uno de sus metas es comprar  su propia casa  y ahí establecer su taller más amplio, perseverando siempre en el trabajo piensa lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en: Patricia is 29 years old and makes articles of clothing.  This will be her second loan through our institution.  At evaluation time Patricia demonstrated a good attitude and was courteous and friendly.  Patricia lives in the city of La Paz, Bolivia and currently lives with her husband.  Both have been working making jackets and jogging suits for the past 10 years.  Patricia got this loan to buy fabric so that she could grow her workshop and be able to deliver an important order.  The workshop is located within her parents’ home.  One of her goals is to buy a home of her own and set up a bigger workshop there.  She expects to reach her goals by persevering in her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, wood, and gas.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a hardworking business-lady.  She runs a hardware shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for over ten years.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.  
She hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested  40, 000 Kenya shillings to buy paint and nails.

loans.use: To buy paint and nails

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah  is married with 8 children. Five of her children go to school.   She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business of selling bananas at the market on a retail basis.  She has been in this business for 6 years and works seven days a week. 

Hadjah has applied for a loan of 1300,000 Ugandans shillings from MCDT-SACCO  which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of bananas and difficulties with their transportation to market. She aspires to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only and also to own a delivery van to ease the problems of transportation.  

Hadjah resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 71 years old. He lives in Gardabani District with his family: his wife – Manana, 43 years old -- and their son and daughter-in-law. Nugzar and Manana are pensioners. They run a family agricultural business, and they have 5 milk cows. Manana produces yogurt, which she sells along with milk in Tbilisi (the country's capital). In addition to farming, Nugzar works as a night watchman for a local company and earns a monthly salary. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris.

Nugzar has requested a loan to expand the dairy farm. He will use the loan to purchase an additional milk cow. Manana and Nugzar will be able to increase their sales of dairy products by 20%. It will have positive impact on the family's total monthly income as well as their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 39-year-old businesslady. She is married to Francis, who is employed. They are blessed with three children aged 19, 16, and eight years old. She has been tailoring and retailing bedsheets and curtains for the past ten years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Catherine is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy materials for sewing curtains and bed covers. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing curtains and bed covers

loans.name: C 1254 Duharanirisuku I Group

texts.en:
Denyse is 37 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 14 and 20 years old, and she takes care of seven relatives. She is the leader of a group called "C 1254 DUHARANIRISUKU I" in the local language. Denyse (raising her hand in the photo) has 1 year of experience selling potatoes. Her business is well-organized.

Denyse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to cultivate more potatoes for resale. With any profit, she will be able to pay her children's school fees and save money for her future.

loans.use: To cultivate more potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Abrahan

texts.es:
José, está soltero, vive con su madre y dos hermanos, viven en casa propia, él administra un ciber café, tiene tres años de estar administrándolo, este lo heredo de su padre, cuenta con experiencia en el manejo del negocio.
El solicita un préstamo para darle el mantenimiento a las maquinas,  comprara algunos accesorios como mauses, bocinas, para las computadoras, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el servicio a los clientes, mejorando algunas condiciones de las PC.
Su objetivo es mantener su negocio rentable, seguir con sus estudios universitarios y poder ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
José is single and lives with his mother and two brothers in their own house. For the past three years he has managed an internet cafe that he inherited from his father. He has experience in the management of the business.

José is requesting this loan in order to provide maintenance for the machines as well as purchase accessories such as mouses and microphones. The loan will help him provide better customer service and improve the conditions of the PCs. His goals are to keep his business profitable, continue with his university studies, and be able to help his mother with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for the internet cafe and for PC maintenance.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is requesting a new loan to buy more clothes, cosmetics, and souvenirs. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that the loan will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, and souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 25 years old, married, and the father of one child. For the last year, he has earned a living by hawking goods in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

Kenneth was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and he is applying for his first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000, to buy additional stock such as vests, hair combs, and socks to sell to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as vests, hair combs, and socks

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children. Only two of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  Florence has a business of poultry farming and works from her home.  She has applied for a loan of 1800000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more chicken feed and chicks. Besides poultry farming she also rears goats and pigs and also does pheasant farming. Florence has been in this business for five years and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation of chicken feed and thieves.  

Florence resides in her own house but  the family has no access to piped water and electricity.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family. She aspires to see her business grow big to 3000 chickens. She also wants to buy a plot of land on which to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take out a new loan to purchase more beverages and many kinds of food to sell to her customers. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more beverages and many kinds of food to sell

loans.name: Lucy Isabel

texts.es: Lucy es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 14 años. Se dedica a la venta de tejidos, joyas, ropas en el mercado central. Durante estos años como socia ella conoció amigas con las cuales comparten experiencias diferentes. Le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su bancomunal ya que aprendió a valorarse a sí misma e invertir su dinero de manera adecuada. Está agradecida con la institución por todas las facilidades de crédito que le han brindado, las cuales le ayudaron tanto para su negocio como en la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como hilos, lanas y tintes.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Communal Bank "Buena Suerte" (Good Luck). She is 60 years old and a single mother of three children. Lucy has been with FINCA Peru for 14 years. She sells knitted items, jewelry, and clothes at the central market. During the years that she has been a member, Lucy has had the chance to make friends with whom she has shared different experiences. She greatly enjoys the training offered by her Communal Bank because she has learned how to value herself and how to invest her money in a proper manner. Lucy is grateful to FINCA for all of the credit services that have been provided since they have helped her with her business and providing for her children's education.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as thread, wool, and dyes.

loans.use: to buy thread, wool, and dyes.

loans.name: Zonia Blanca

texts.es: Zonia es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 63 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 7 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años. Es modista, a la vez se dedica a la venta de ropas y cosméticos por catálogo. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros. Logró la educación de sus hijos. Las capacitaciones  que recibe en su Bancomunal le gustan mucho ya que con ellas aprendió a invertir su dinero y practicar los valores. Agradece a la Institución por todas las facilidades de crédito que le brindaron ya que gracias a ello logró sus objetivos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los productos que vende como ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en: Zonia is a 63 year old widow and mother of 7 children. She is a member of the communal bank called Buena Suerte and has worked with FINCA Peru for 15 years.   Zonia works selling clothing and cosmetics by catalog.  She feels proud that through her earnings she was able to provide an education for her children.  She likes the training and support she has received from the communal bank as she's learned how to invest her money and manage it.  She appreciates the loans as they've enabled her to reach her goals.  This loan will be used to invest in more merchandise, clothing and beauty products, to sell.

loans.use: to purchase the clothing and beauty products that she resells for her business.

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa tienen casa propia, tambien tiene ganado, el aprendió desde joven este trabajo, pues su padre realizaba este trabajo, teniendo a este tiempo mucha experiencia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla de maíz, herbicidas, con esto lograra tener el dinero necesario para poder invertir y obtener una buena producción de granos básicos.
La aspiración de José es mejorar su condición, poder tener éxito en los cultivos y velar por las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
José is a farmer. He lives with his wife and they have their own house. He also has cattle, and learned this occupation from a young age, as his father did the same work. Now he has a great deal of experience.

He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, seed corn and herbicides. With this he will manage to have the money necessary to be able to invest and obtain good production of staple grains.

José's ambition is to improve his situation, to have a successful crop, and to look out for the needs of his household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed corn, and herbicides.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 28 years old. She lives in Gardabani District, East Georgia with her family: husband – Nikoloz and two daughters (12 and 7 years old). Both children go to school. Nikoloz is a painter and works in a private company as painter-designer. He gets a monthly salary. Leila runs a family-owned dairy farm with two milk cows.
