She milks cows twice a day and produces cheese. Twice a week she takes cheese to an open market in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Leila requested credit for purchasing calves. She will feed them for 6 months and sell grown calves in late fall for a higher price. The family will get additional income. Leila plans to reinvest it in the same business to expand the family farm and make it more profitable. In the long term, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is 42 years old. She lives in a small village in Gardabani District, East Georgia, with her sons (aged 15 and 18), her 16-year-old daughter, and her mother (who is a pensioner). The younger children go to school and the elder son is a worker in the village. Darejan runs the family's dairy farm. They have two milk cows. Darejan produces yogurt and milk, which she sells in the village. Along with agriculture, Darejan is a dressmaker. She provides services to the villagers, and she mainly works on women’s clothing. The family's total average monthly income is 550 Laris.

Darejan has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for the expansion of their existing cattle shed. When her cows deliver calves, she will be able to raise them herself instead of selling them. This will allow Darejan to increase the number of dairy cows on the farm, allowing her to increase her production and sales of dairy products in turn. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her existing cattle shed

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai is requesting a new loan to buy more animal feed, and chickens, ducklings, and frogs for raising and selling. Gai's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, chickens, ducklings and frogs for raising and selling

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and range of construction materials to stock her store. Ngan's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to stock in her store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old, married and the father of two children. For the last 5 years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his phone accessory shop. He earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his first loan, for 30,000 KES, to buy additional phone accessories such as phone batteries and phone covers for his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional phone accessories such as phone batteriesand phone covers for his customers

loans.name: Rommel Oswaldo

texts.es:
ROMMEL OSWALDO tiene 22 años de edad es soletro no tiene hijos, vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

ROMMEL OSWALDO es controlador en una unidad de trasnporte. 

Solicita el crédito para pagar una deuda. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá pagar la deuda que tubo cuándo se enfermo de gravedad.La deuda la cancelara en Guaranda. 

El sueño es poder tener un negocio propio y comprar una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly y futbol.
texts.en:
Rommel Oswaldo is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in Guaranda, which is in Bolívar Province.

Rommel Oswaldo is a driver in the transportation sector. He is requesting a loan in order to pay off a debt. With the help of this loan, he will be able to repay a debt he acquired when he was gravely ill. The debt will be paid off in Guaranda. His dream is to have his own business and to buy a house.

In his free time, Rommel Oswaldo enjoys playing volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Maria Emma

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella es ama de casa, tambien atiende una crianza de cerdos, junto con su esposo tambien realiza la siembra de maíz y frijoles, con estas ocupaciones han logrado mantenerse en su hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de frijoles, abono y foliares, para sembrar, este préstamo le dará los recursos económicos para poder iniciar la siembra, con la que espera fortalecer y obtener una buena cosecha.
Ella quiere salir adelante con su familia, mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar a su hijo dándole lo necesario.
texts.en: Maria lives with her husband and son.  She is a housewife, but also works together with her husband raising pigs, and growing corn and beans.  These businesses allow them to maintain their home.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and beans to plant.  The money provides the resources they need to begin the planting, and hopefully obtain a good harvest.  She wants to continue to improve the quality of life for her family, increase their income and provide well for her son.

loans.use: to purchase beans and fertilizer.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Millicent is married to George and they are blessed with three children, ages 15, 13, and 9 years respectively. Millicent owns a boutique, a business she started 11 years ago and earns a monthly income of 22,000 KES. 

She has requested her first loan from KADET worth 30,000 KES to purchase ladies' shoes and handbags for resale. The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business.

Her future hopes are to empower other women through her business performance.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' shoes and handbags for sale.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 45 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 2  hijas a su cargo, Vive en casa propia con su cónyuge, él  vive en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, departamento de Lambayeque, además cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.
	
La actividad principal que desarrolla Jaime es la crianza y venta de animales como: patos, pavos, caprinos y porcinos, los alimenta a base de concentrado y cuando alcanza el tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona,  adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de polvillo y materiales de construcción ( arenilla, piedras, arena gruesa, ) lo que le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales,  esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   

El monto del crédito solicitado es de S/. 1500 nuevos soles y será para invertir en la compra de aves menores para engorde y compra de mayor cantidad de polvillo.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Esto le va permitir ir creciendo con su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 45 year old man. He is married and has two daughters to support. He lives in his own house which is equipped with the basic services of water and electricity with his wife in the rural area of the Mórrope district in the department of Lambayeque. The place where he lives is a small community with around 100 families. 
	
Jaime's main economic activity is rearing and selling animals such as ducks, turkeys, goats and pigs. He feeds them with concentrate and when they reach the exact size and weight he markets them to wholesale merchants in the region. He also sells animal feed and construction materials (fine sand, stones, coarse sand) which provides him with additional income. He has been working in this area for 15 years and learnt this activity from his parents, so he knows the area perfectly. The business is located in his home. 

The amount of the loan requested is 1500 nuevos soles and it will be used to invest in buying small birds to fatten up, and to buy a greater quantity of animal feed. This business has competition but it also has a large market for its commercialisation. This will allow it to grow along with Jaime's family.

loans.use: to buy birds such as turkeys, ducks and hens and to buy animal feed (derived from rice).

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 50 años de edad, medre soltera de 5 hijos y socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años. Se dedica a la venta de especerías y  se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros. Le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que gracias a ellas pudo aprender mucho a trabajar, a invertir y a ahorrar. Agradece a la Institución por las facilidades de crédito que le brindan. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de especerías al por mayor como ajos, condimentos, ajíes.
texts.en: Ana is a member of the communal bank called Buena Suerte, and has worked with FINCA Peru for 15 years.    She is 50 years old and a single mother of 5 children.  Ana sells spices and she feels proud of what she has been able to achieve through her earnings and savings.  She likes the training and support she's received from the communal bank as they've taught her a lot about work, investing and saving.   She appreciates the loans she's received, and she will use the new loan to purchase spices from a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale spices for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Hidalgo Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO MIGUEL HIDALGO ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO, CUENTA CON 7 INTEGRANTES ELLAS SON AMIGAS DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS.
ESTRE GRUPO SE LLAMA ASI YA QUE LA COLONIA DONDE VIVEN TIENE ESE NOMBRE.
MARTHA PATRICIA ES UNA INTEGRRANTE DEL GRUPO, TIENE 46 AÑOS ES CASADA TIENE 2 HIJOS DE 20Y 30 AÑOS DE EDAD.
MARTHA VENDE JOYERIA  DE ORO Y PLATA ENTRE SUS FAMILIARES Y VECINOS, Y ASI PODER AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DL HOGAR.
EL SUÑO DE MARTHA ES TENER UN LOCAL GRANDE,DE VENTA DE JOYERIA EN UN CENTRO COMERCIAL,PARA TENER UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
The group "Miguel Hidalgo" is a solidarity group that is affiliated with Credituyo. The group has seven members, all of whom are friends who have known each other for many years. Their group is named after the subdivision where they live.

Martha Patricia is a member of the group. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children (ages 20 and 30). Martha sells gold and silver jewelry to relatives and neighbors so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. Her dream is to have a large jewelry store at a shopping center so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es:
Jose, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, en su familia todos trabajan, su trabajo lo inicio desde muy joven ayudando a su padre, no tiene un horario fijo, pero si cuenta con experiencia por varios años.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, esto le ayudara para aplicárselos al cultivo, que le ayuden a prevenirlo de plagas y que le aumenten su desarrollo y producción.
El objetivo de José es que sus cosechas sean abundantes, para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who lives with his wife and two children. Everyone in his family works. José began working at a very young age and learned his trade from his father. He does not work on a set schedule, but he has several years of experience.

José is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as compost, insecticides, and pesticides that he can apply on his crops. This will help prevent pests and also increase development and production. José's goal is to have an abundant harvest so that he can support his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en: Leah is a resident of Kitale, where she has worked as a farmer for the last eight years. Her farm produces mainly milk, which she sells to a local market.  She is married and the mother of six children who range in age from 20 to three years old. Her goal is to have a farm with four cows, and she is applying for a loan for KES 41,600 to buy and insure a new dairy cow. She will use the additional income made possible by this cow to meet basic family needs and venture into other family businesses. Leah is happy to be a member of Juhudi Kilimo and is committed to repay the loan fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is requesting this loan to buy a range of products, including beads, pins, and assorted hair and beauty accessories, to sell to her customers. A previous loan allowed her to expand her business and earn a higher income, which she used to support her family. She hopes that this new loan will allow her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft and hard flour, Royal brand baking powder, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: C 4834 Abahuzamuco Group

texts.en: Valentine is 25 years old, married and the mother of three children. She leads a loan group called "C 4834 Abahuzamuco" in the local language. Valentine (who is the second person from the right in this photo) has four years of experience selling shoes. Her business is well-organized and she works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day of the week. She is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders to buy more shoes to sell to her customers. She will use any additional profit she earns to save for the future and re-invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 36 años, casada con  tres hijos de las edades 10, 4 y 2 años,  tiene como actividad la venta de miel, la misma que compra por mayor para su posterior venta por menor, actividad que desarrolla todos los días de la semana, ella es una persona joven muy trabajadora,  su esposo quien también trabaja en una localidad cercana a la ciudad de La Paz, el destino del crédito es para la compra de miel por mayor para su venta, la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora siempre está viendo en que negocio invertir sus ganancias, se siente feliz ya agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 36 years old, married, and has three children (ages 10, 4, and 2). Her business involves selling honey, which she buys in bulk so that she can eventually resell it in smaller amounts. She conducts her business every day of the week. María is a young hardworking individual. Her husband also works in a town near the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to buy honey in bulk that she can sell. Sra. María is a hard worker who always looks to invest her earnings in her business. She is pleased and expresses her appreciation to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy honey in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Lidya

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un préstamo para seguir trabajando en el negocio y seguir creciendo, ella comprara semilla de marañón  y productos no perecederos para la tienda que ha iniciado despues del prestamo anterior, como azúcar, frijoles, detergentes, jabón.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo pues ahora posee una nueva fuente de ingreso con la tienda de víveres, esto le dará una nueva oportunidad de tener ganancias y que su familia cuente con este negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is seeking a loan so she can continue developing her business. She will buy cashew seeds and non-perishable items such as sugar, beans, detergent, and soap. These would be for the shop that she has started since her last loan. 

The last loan has had a positive effect as she now has a new source of income with the store. This will give her a new opportunity to earn money to help her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds, sugar, beans, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is 41 years old, married and the father of three children who range in age from 3 years to 12 years old. He describes himself as jovial, creative and ambitious. He earns a living by operating a retail business where he sells bricks. He has been in this business for 14 years and employs five people. His business is located near a busy town, and most of his customers are institutions and local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is a shortage of funds he can use to improve his business. He is requesting a loan for KES 50,000 loan to buy a quarry worth KES 25,000 and hire workers who will cost another KES 25,000. His goal for the future is to buy a vehicle for transportation, and to own five quarries within five years. In the future, he also hopes to own several acres of land.

loans.use: to buy quarry worth KES 25,000 and hire workers who cost another KES 25,000.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling used clothing to all types of people. She also earns additional income by renting rooms. She has applied for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers. Her major business challenges are the seasonal nature of her work and people who default on their payments. She wants to see her business grow so that she can afford to send her children to university, and she hopes to do that by importing used clothes from Mombasa. She lives in a home that she owns and which has access to electricity and piped-in water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es: Cesárea es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 54 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años. Se dedica a la venta de cereales (habas, arveja, pallares).  Está feliz por pertenecer a la Institución por que conoció amigas con las que comparte realidades diferentes, participan de las capacitaciones que reciben en su Bancomunal. Con las facilidades de préstamo logró estabilidad económica en su hogar y en su negocio. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para surtir el negocio.
texts.en:
Cesárea is a member of the community bank Buena Suerte (Good Luck), and is 54 years old. She is married and has three children, and has been a member of FINCA Perú for ten years. She makes a living selling staple products, such as lima beans, peas, and white beans. She is happy to be a member of the community bank, because she has made good friends there with whom she can share life experiences and participate in bank activities. 

With the support from this loan, Cesárea hopes to gain more economic stability in her home and business. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains and staple products to stock her business.

loans.name: Nestor Armando

texts.es:
NESTOR ARMANDO tiene 38 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

 NESTOR ARMANDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cebada, trigo además a la cría de gallinas. 

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, urea, cebada, fertilizantes y comprar gallinas.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y las gallinas para criarles para poder venderles.

Las compras lo hace en Guaranda. El sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son seguir trabajando con dedicación.

En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en la agricultura .
texts.en:
Nestor Armando is 38 years old and lives in a common law marriage. He has two children and lives in Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.  Nestor Armando works in agriculture in the farming of corn, barley and wheat. He also raises hens. He requests the loan to be able to buy seeds, urea, barley, fertilizers and and hens.   

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers, as well as hens so he can raise them and sell them. He carries out his sales in Guaranda. The dream is to be able to improve his life conditions. The challenges that he faces are to be able to continue working with dedication.  In his free time he likes to work in agriculture.

loans.use: to be able to buy seeds, urea, barley, fertilizers and hens.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, está solicitando un préstamo para continuar con su trabajo agrícola, pues está iniciando el cultivo de maíz y chile, comprara semilla de maíz, abono y herbicidas, para aplicarlos en la agricultura.
Él ha mejorado su productividad de granos básicos, mejoro su economía familiar con el préstamo anterior, actualmente está bien estable con su familia.
texts.en:
Israel is requesting a loan to continue with his agricultural work. He is beginning the cultivation of corn and chile. He will buy corn seeds, fertilizer and herbicides, to apply them to the agriculture.

He has improved his productivity of basic grains. He improved his family's finances with the previous loan, and is now stable with his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is 24 years old. He has been in poultry farming for four years, producing and selling eggs to the local market. He is married with a three-year-old child.

Ayub has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He believes the dairy cow will improve his income and make life better, in addition to providing milk for the family's consumption.

Ayub says the challenges of farming include animal diseases and a lack of capital.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a farmer from a village in Gardabani district, East Georgia. She is unmarried and lives with her 82-year-old mother. Lia is the only income provider for the family. She takes care of a milk cow and produces 20 kg of cheese per month on average. She sells it in the village to local dairy products retailers. Lia also grows maize on family-owned 1.5 hectares of land. She sells the harvested maize during the year in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 350 laris, including the pension of Lia’s mother. 

Lia requested credit to rent a tractor for tilling the land. She will sow the maize and work hard on the plot during the spring and summer to get a good harvest in late summer. She will sell the corn and use the profit for financing the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for renting a tractor for tilling the land

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married and has three children. She runs a butchery to earn a living, and she has been in the business since 2009.  She also does farming to supplement her income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business in the future. Jane has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha  de 38 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años. Ella  es la propietaria de una tienda de ranchos, víveres y refrescos, que emprendió por iniciativa de su cónyuge quien se dedicaba a la administración de una tienda; con esta experiencia se abrieron paso a desarrollar su propia aventura de negocios, con la que hoy generan los principales ingresos del hogar. Esto ocurrió  hace 12 años,  cuando decidieron arrendar una casa, que hoy es  la vivienda donde habitan y adecuaron allí su negocio. Gracias al trabajo conjunto, sus esfuerzos y la dedicación que le profesan a su negocio, este se ha  consolidado, generando una clientela fija y hoy son muy reconocidos en su barrio y en sectores ubicados alrededor de ellos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus principales clientes son las amas de casa, que compran al detal los artículos de la canasta familiar, que requieren sus hogares. En sus metas de crecimiento empresarial, se le presenta el desafío de no contar con un capital de trabajo suficiente, para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina, mercancía de miscelánea para surtirla, porque el mes de Mayo es uno de las temporadas en las cuales sus ventas se incrementan,  por efecto de las fiestas familiares que celebran las familias y también las religiosas que generan un buen volumen de clientes y esto es justamente lo que incrementa sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha, age 38, lives with her husband and two children, ages 9 and 12.  She is the proprietor of a store that sells snacks, groceries, and soft drinks.  She undertook this business through her husband’s initiative. He worked at running a store.  

This experience paved their way to develop their own business adventure.  The business now generates the main income for the household.  This happened 12 years ago, when they decided to rent a house.  This is where they now live, and they have adapted the house for their business.

Thanks to their joint work, their efforts, and their dedication to their business, it has become a robust business.  It has generated fixed clientele, and it is very well-known in her neighborhood and in surrounding areas.  She makes her sales for cash, and her main customers are housewives who buy retail stapes they need for their households.  

Her goals for the growth of her business are faced with the challenge of not having enough working capital to expand her business.  That is the reason she turns to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  

She will use the loan to buy a display case and varied merchandise to stock it.  She will do this because May is one of the times that her sales increase.  The increase is due to the family festivities and religious holidays that the families celebrate.  These festivities and holidays generate a good volume of customers, and that is exactly what increases her income.

loans.use: to buy a display case and varied merchandise to stock it.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos, socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años. Se dedica a la siembra de tuberculos que luego los vende al por mayor y menor en los diferentes mercados, también vende papa en el mercado Nery García de Ayacucho. Le gusta mucho asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable, a invertir su dinero de manera adecuada y a educar muy bien a sus hijos. Su meta es  comprar  su terreno y construir su vivienda. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y semilla para la siembra de tubérculos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Buena Suerte (Good Luck) Community Bank. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years. 

María grows root crops which she then sells either wholesale or retail in various markets. She also sells potatoes in the Nery García market in Ayacucho. She really enjoys attending the Community Bank meetings as she learns a lot about being responsible, about spending her money appropriately, and about bringing up her children well.

Her goal is to buy some land and build a house. This loan money will be used to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 45-year-old farmer. She is married to Anthony, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with four children aged 22, 18, 15, and 10 years. She has been a dairy farmer as her primary business and a mixed-crop farmer as her secondary business for the past ten years. Her monthly income of KES 19,000 is used to support her family. 

Eunice is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Eunice will use the loan to purchase animal feeds, fertilizer, and seedlings. She will use the remaining money to start poultry farming. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to export her products, which will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds, fertilizer, and seedlings.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Eva has a clothing boutique where she sells dresses, skirts, and blouses. She has been in this business for ten years. She works seven days a week and sells to all categories of people. Her business challenges include transportation and her customers' difficulties in reaching her during the rainy season. In addition to her clothing business she also generates additional income from rental rooms. 

Eva has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more new skirts, blouses, and dresses. She aspires to seeing her business grow into a fully stocked boutique.

loans.use: To buy more new dresses, skirts, and blouses to sell

loans.name: Mirtha Victoria

texts.es: Mirtha es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años. Es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, se siente orgullosa de sus hijas porque son universitarias, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque le enseñaron a ser responsable y no ser pesimista.  Está agradecida con la Institución por todas las facilidades de préstamos que le ofrecen y gracias a ello logro construir su vivienda. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the “Buena Suerte” (Good Luck) communal bank.  She is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for ten years.  She owns a grocery store.

She is proud of her daughters because they are university students.  She likes to attend her communal bank’s meetings because they teach her to be responsible and to not be pessimistic.  

She is grateful to the institution for the good terms of the loans they offer her.  Thanks to the loans, she managed to build her home.  She will use the requested new loan to buy groceries in order to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
JOSE LEONARDO tiene 51 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

JOSE LEONARDO da clases en una escuela el es profesor primario.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, barillla, eternit, ladrillo.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar el arreglo de la vivienda para poder vivir en mejores condiciones porque la casa es muy pequeña.

La compras de los materiales lo har{a en Guaranda. el sueño es poder mantenerce en el trabajo, dar la educación a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y realizar carteles de escritura.
texts.en: Jose Leonardo is 51 and is married with 3 children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.  He teaches in an elementary school.  He is requesting a loan to buy cement, bars, metal sheets, and bricks.  With the help of this credit, he will be able to make repairs to his home to be able to live in better conditions because his house is very small.  He will buy the materials in Guaranda.  His dream is to be able to maintain his job and to give his children an education so they can become professionals.  In his free time, he likes to read and make hand-written posters.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars, metal sheets, and bricks.

loans.name: Bibiane

texts.en:
Bibiane is 53 years old and married with four children between 10 and 25 years old. She sells fertilizer, and she has been in this business for 4 years. 

Bibiane has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more fertilizer, which she will sell wholesale to farmers. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old, married to David, and blessed with three children, aged six, three, and two years. She runs a restaurant, a business she started four years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

Florence has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase 20 kg of rice, one bag of beans, 50 kg of sugar, and 40 litres of cooking oil to be used in the restaurant. The profit she earns will be reinvested in her business. Her dream is to grow her business and be financially stable. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old and an enterprising businesslady. She is married to Peter, who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children, aged 21, 17, and 14 years. She has been baking cakes for the past 14 years. Her monthly income of KES 10,000 is used to support her family. 

Lucy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and an oven. She will use the remaining amount to rent a house for her business. With the anticipated profit, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a hotel (restaurant).

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and an oven and rent a space for her business

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael, 39, is the mother of three children between the ages of eleven and eighteen years. She has been farming for six years, and her farm mainly produces milk.

Abigael has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says that the loan will help her boost her farming income and provide milk for the family's consumption. She says animal diseases are her major business challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Teodora Veronica

texts.es:
Teodora, está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en la tienda, comprándose productos para surtirla como condimentos, pastas, sopas, productos de higiene personal, con esto lograra mejorar el negocio y tener a la mano lo necesario para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le dio la oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas, pues surtió el negocio de mucha mercadería, además logro terminar la construcción de un cuarto en la casa.
texts.en:
Teodora is requesting a loan in order to be able to invest in the store.  She will do this by purchasing products to stock the store.  She will buy products like condiments, pasta, soup, and personal hygiene products.  By doing this she will manage to improve her business.  She will also be able to have on hand what her customers need.

The previous loan had a positive impact.  It gave her the opportunity to improve her sales.  She stocked the business with a lot of merchandise.  She also managed to finish building a room in her house.

loans.use: to buy products like condiments, pasta, soup, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 58 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 7 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Es dueña de una tienda en la cual vende baterías para vehículos menores y vehículos pesados. Está agradecida con la institución por que le da muchas facilidades de préstamo para así hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la condición económica de su familia. Las capacitaciones  que recibe en su Bancomunal le gustan mucho ya que ellas le enseñaron a ser responsable y no ser pesimista. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más baterías para vehículos para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en: Irene is a member of the communal bank “Buena Suerte” (Good Luck). She is 58 years old, is a widow and has 7 children. She has been with FINCA Peru for 5 years. She owns a shop where she sells batteries for small and heavy vehicles. She is grateful to the institution because it provides her with many loan facilities to help her to expand her business and to improve her family's financial situation. She likes the training she receives from the communal bank very much since it has taught her to be responsible and not to be a pessimist. She is asking for a loan to buy more car batteries to resell in her business.

loans.use: to buy more car batteries to resell in her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married man. He has a son who is five years old. He describes himself to be honest and polite. He operates a tailoring retail store. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a busy town, and his primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from his customers. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy fabric. Earlier on, Peter had taken out loans of KES 80,000, 50,000 and 20,000. He managed to pay the whole amount owed. His business goal is to venture into the bakery business in addition to his tailoring business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will run a clothes manufacturing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es: Mireya invirtió su anterior credikiva en productos para tocador, como perfumes, ropa, bisutería productos de belleza y también compró medicina natural. Todos estos artículos los vendió, rotando rápidamente su mercancía y aumentando ligeramente su capital de trabajo. Con su nuevo kiva, al cual está aplicando,  comprará ropa y productos de belleza en mayor volumen, así mismo comprará un plan de minutos a celulares, para continuar aprovechando que tiene una buena clientela, a la que brindándole lo que necesita, genera nuevamente el incremento de sus utilidades en el negocio. Su mensaje a los financiadoras de Kiva es el siguiente: “Bendiciones para todo el grupo Kiva y que sigan apoyando a nuestros hermanos colombianos para cumplir los sueños de toda una familia. “
texts.en:
Mireya used her previous loan with Kiva to buy items such as perfumes, clothing, jewelry, beauty products, and also to buy natural medicines. She sold all these items and had a rapid turnover, slightly increasing her working capital. 

With this new loan that she is seeking, Mireya will buy clothing and beauty products in greater volume. She will also buy a cell phone plan so that she can continue serving her customers well. She wants to have for sale everything they need and thus increasing the amount of money she earns. Her message to Kiva donors is as follows: “Blessings on the whole of the Kiva group, and may you continue helping our brothers and sisters in Colombia so they can reach their dreams.”

loans.use: to buy buy clothing and beauty products and also a cell phone plan

loans.name: Wait For Me Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Wait For Me group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each member in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is 28 years old. She is married with two children: one in primary school, and the other is not of a school-going age. Kadiatu sells dishes, palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), onions, salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Mr. S. B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the staff of a reputable company based in Tonkolili, in northern Sierra Leone. These guys have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni City, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, these gentlemen can pay school fees for their children, buy house-building materials, invest in the business, etc. And at the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. Their company’s finance officer is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

S.B. is the leader of this group. Born in Magburaka Town, in northern Sierra Leone, S.B. is married to a teacher, and the couple has eight children, six of whom are attending primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. S.B. has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, boards, nails, cement, etc., for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, boards, nails, cement, etc., for the construction of a family dwelling

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, y socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales (vitaminas prolife) y tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal ya que en ellas comparte experiencias con sus amigas, se siente alegre y motivada. Agradece a la Institución por las facilidades de crédito  que le brindan por tanto ella cumple con los reglamentos establecidos en su Bancomunal. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos naturales y  abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en: Vilma is a member of the communal bank “Buena Suerte” (Good Luck). She is 56 years old, married and has 2 children. She has been with FINCA Peru for 3 years. She earns her living selling natural products (Prolife vitamins) and has a grocery store. She likes to go to communal bank meetings since in those meetings she shares experiences with her friends and she feels happy and motivated. She is grateful to the institution for the loan facilities it offers and for this reason she always abides by the rules established by the communal bank. She is asking for a loan to buy natural products and groceries for her shop.

loans.use: to buy natural products and groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria de 59 años de edad, soltera, de oficio comerciante, originaria de Granada, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 40 años, realizo estudios hasta la primaria. Inicio su actividad en un humilde tramo que alquilaba en el mercado,  luego por medio de ayuda le cedieron un local donde solo tenía que hacerse cargo de la limpieza y de remodelarlo el cual acepto, ella con el tiempo y esfuerzo propio  ha ido acondicionando el lugar para una mejor presentación que atraiga mas clientela, saca su negocio adelante por si sola con el deseo de mejorar cada día tanto en el servicio de comida como en la mejora del local.
Realiza el préstamo para comprar leña, carne, pollo, aceite, arroz, plátanos, toda la materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, sus planes futuros es mantener siempre su negocio para satisfacción de su clientela pues se considera una persona muy responsable con sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 59, is single; she’s a merchant from Granada who has been selling food for 40 years.  She only attended elementary school.  She started her activity in a humble stretch of leased space in the market and later on by means of some help she was ceded a locale where all she had to do was clean and remodel it; she accepted it and in time and through her own efforts she’s been gradually equipping it so that it will be more attractive to customers.  She moves her business forward by herself hoping to improve her food service more each day like with the improvements to the locale.

She is taking out the loan to buy firewood, meat, chicken, oil, rice and bananas, all the raw materials she needs to prepare her dishes.  Her plan for the future is to stay in business to please her customers because she considers herself to be a person who is very responsible toward her customers.

loans.use: to buy firewood, meat, chicken, oil, rice and bananas.

loans.name: Anaclovia

texts.es:
Anaclovia, solicita un préstamo para aumentar la capacidad del negocio, pues de esta manera podrá atraer a más clientela, comprara ropa en variedad como blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, ya que tiene el plan de crecer en el comercio y a través de los préstamos está logrando su posición en el mercado.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue favorable, pues mejoro su nivel de inventario, ha tenido buenas ganancias y su único inconveniente han sido problemas de salud pero que se están superando.
texts.en:
Anaclovia is asking for a loan to increase her business’ capacity in order to be able to take care of more customers.  She will buy assorted clothes like blouses, skirts, pants and underwear because she plans to grow in the market and by means of the loans she’s securing her place in the market.

The previous loan had a favorable effect because she improved her inventory’s level; she’s had good profits and the only obstacle she’s faces has been some health issues but she’s overcoming them.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eugenia Magdalena

texts.es:
EUGENIA MAGDALENA tiene 40 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad , vive con el esposo y con el hijo en Guaranda  Provincia Bolívar.

EUGENIA MAGDALENA es una mujer que se gana la vida lavando ropa, además recibe penciones alimenticias. Solicita el crédito para realizarce una operación de los ojos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la salud. La operación se la realizarán en la ciudad de Riobamba. 

El sueño  es poder arreglar la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener una buena salud y comprarse una casa. En el tiempo libre sigue cursos de aprendisaje de belleza.
texts.en:
Eugenia Magdalena, 40, is married and has a 13 year old son.  She lives with her husband and son in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  Eugenia Magdalena is a woman who earns her livelihood washing clothes and she also provides regular meals for people.  

She’s asking for the loan in order to have eye surgery.  With help from the loan her health will improve.  The operation will take place in the city of Riobamba.

Her dream is to fix up her house.  The challenges she faces are having good health and to buy a house.  In her free time she is taking beauty courses.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the staff of a very reputable company in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. This group of colleagues have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city, to apply for a loan. With the help of these loans, they will be able to do or invest in things that their salaries alone cannot let them do or invest in. For example, some will be able to buy pieces of household furniture or house building materials, pay school fees for their children, invest in agriculture or in business, etc. At the end of each month, their company’s financial officer will repay the loan on their behalf.

Musa is the leader of this team. The 42-year-old is a native of Port Loko. He is married to a businesswoman, and they have one child who is attending secondary school.  Musa has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials for the completion of a house he had begun. He will buy iron, corrugated zincs, board, paints, cements, etc.

loans.use: To buy iron, corrugated zincs, board, paints, cements, etc.

loans.name: Colletta

texts.en:
Colleta is a married woman. She has 2 children ranging from 5 years old to 15 years old. She describes herself as patient. 

Colleta operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low bargaining power from the customers. She will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy clothes. 

Colletta had previously taken a loan of 10,000 KES, of which she managed to pay back the entire amount. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a 25 year old single woman. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. 

Doreen was employed earlier as a househelp. She decided to start a grocery store where she has been selling  vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, kale, onions, etc. for 4 years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of vegetables. 

Doreen will use the loan of 15,000 KES loan to buy vegetables. This is her first loan. Her business goal is to run another grocery store in her nearby town  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future with the profits generated she will run a cereal retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Marcia Janneth

texts.es:
MARCIA JANNETH tiene 20 años de edad es soletra no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de bolívar.

MARCIA JANNETH se dedica al comercio de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de animales cómo cerdos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales para cruiarlos y poder venderlos.

Las compras lo hará en Guanujo. El sueño es poder casarse y tener hijos. El desafío al que se enfrenta es estudiar. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Marcia Janneth is 20 years old, she is single, and she does not have children.  She lives with her parents in the Guaranda province of Bolivar.

Maria Janneth sells pigs.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy animals, such as pigs.  She will purchase them in Guanujo.  

Her dream is to get married and have children.  Her current challenge is in studying.  In her free time she likes working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy animals, such as pigs.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.es:
Reginaldo, está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la crianza de cerdos y venta de refrescos, él comprara refrescos, agua en bolsa, gaseosas, y tambien dos cerdos,  esto le ayudara para mejorar su negocio y tener la posibilidad de generar mejores ventas.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a mejorar el negocio en la produccion de flores, en su familia se han mantenido las condiciones y dentro del negocio él desea ir creciendo.
texts.en:
Reginaldo is seeking a loan to invest in raising pigs and selling soft drinks.  He will buy soft drinks, water, refreshments, and also two pigs.  This will help him improve his business and give him the possibility of increasing his sales.

He had a good experience with his previous loan.  It helped improve his flower production business.  His family has maintained their living conditions, and with this business he hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, refreshments, and also two pigs.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha de 48 años de edad es habitante de Granada, casada, madre de 4 hijos solo el menor esta a su cargo, ella realizo estudios hasta la primaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 20 años.  Inicio su actividad con su primer esposo en un  tramo que tenían en el mercado, luego por problemas matrimoniales se separo y tuvo que comprarle el tramo para continuar con el negocio comenzando con poquito inventario, después fue invirtiendo con ahorros y apoyo de otras instituciones, actualmente recibe el apoyo de su compañero de vida que le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad, su expectativa es crecer en productos que aun no tiene en existencias y que le demanda la clientela.
 Realiza el préstamo para comprar granos básicos  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, etc. Ella estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá surtir su puesto el cual le traerá  mayores ventas y a la vez podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes con el objetivo de seguir creciendo en su negocio para un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Martha, who is 48 years old, lives in Granada. She is married and has four children. Her youngest child is the only who lives with her currently. She has an elementary school education, and has sold groceries for twenty years. She began her business with her first husband with a space in the local market. As a result of marital problems, she separated from her husband and had to purchase the space from him to continue her business. She had very little inventory at the time, but has been investing her savings and has received loans from other institutions. Currently, she receives help from her lifer partner, who helps her with household costs. She sells her products in her community, and she hopes to increase her inventory of products which she currently does not have but which her customers have requested.
She is requesting the loan to purchase basic goods such as rice, beans, and sugar, etc. She believes the loan will help her to be able to fill her market space, which will provide her with better sales and satisfy her customers’ requests at the same time. Her goal is for her business to keep growing so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods such as rice, beans, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto se dedica a alquilar lavadoras, ofrece el servicio de telecomunicaciones por minutos y vende mercancía variada; tres actividades con las que genera ingreso y apoya el ingreso de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 a 18 años. Su negocio inició una vez regresó de Venezuela, país fronterizo donde vivía y trajo consigo unos ahorros que le sirvieron como capital semilla, para emprender su propia aventura de negocios, que le ayudara al sustento de su hogar, debido a que no encontró oportunidades laborales. Él compró 6 lavadoras, un taxi de servicio público y dos celulares, en compañía de su hermano, con lo cual ha logrado el sostenimiento de su negocio y ha agregado aun otros servicio, el  de recargas a celulares, que es muy rentable, también ha  mejorado su infraestructura de negocio, con nuevas lavadoras, porque su clientela ha crecido. Su meta mas adelante, es posicionarse en el mercado comercial de la tecnología celular y quieren vender accesorios y aparatos más modernos; su mayor desafío es no tener suficiente capital de trabajo para hacer inversiones de manera inmediata, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara recargas para celulares, hará reparaciones técnicas a sus lavadoras, para que no se deterioren y con ellos fortalecerá de manera inmediata su negocio, haciéndolo cada vez mas exitoso.
texts.en:
Alberto leases washing machines and provides telecommunication services by the minute; he also sells general merchandise.  He generates income to support his family, composed of his wife and two children who are 14 and 18 years old, with these three businesses.  

He started his business when he returned from Venezuela, a bordering country where he used to live.  He brought some savings with him that served as seed capital to start his own business venture that will help him support his home because he didn’t find employment opportunities.

He bought six washing machines, a public service taxi and two mobile phones together with his brother with which he was able to sustain his business.  He’s added more services, mobile phone recharges, which is very profitable.  He’s also improved the business’ infrastructure with new washing machines because his clientele has grown.

His goal for later on is to position himself in the mobile phone technology commercial marketplace; they want to sell accessories and more modern equipment.  His greatest challenge is lacking sufficient working capital to make the investment immediately and this is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo by means of which he will buy mobile phone recharges and repair his washing machines so that they will not wear away and with this he’ll strengthen his business making it more successful each time.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharges and to repair his washing machines.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo de 64 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y es padre de dos hijos en las edades de 42 y 31 años.  Allí se dedica a la venta de víveres y lácteos especialmente de queso, negocio que inició hace un poco más de 30 años, después que quedara desempleado, pues trabajaba en una empresa importante del país. Él empezó vendiendo arroz, aceite y  en general artículos de la canasta familiar y posteriormente se posicionó en la venta de queso por kilos que distribuye en tiendas, puntos comerciales y entre clientes fijos que le encargan, porque conocen la calidad con la cual Bernardo trabaja. Su mercado se extiende cada vez más, pero Bernardo no tiene el suficiente capital de trabajo para inyectar a su negocio y crecer más rápidamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, víveres en mayor volumen, pues tiene muchas cuentas por cobrar, que no alcanza a recuperar en corto tiempo y nuevos clientes que hacen pedidos y con ellos le cuesta trabajo ser oportuno en la entrega de los productos. La razón de éxito de su inversión es que  logrará financiar su cartera de créditos y responder rápidamente a nuevos clientes con los cuales fortalecerá aun más sus ventas y su base de clientes. Su meta mas adelante es lograr tener un punto comercial y un vehículo para transportar sus pedidos; auguramos que con su persistente trabajo y disciplina Bernardo muy seguramente alcanzará todo lo que se proponga, para lograr cada vez mas bienestar.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 64, lives in the south of the city; he’s the father of two children who are 42 and 31 years old.  He sells groceries and dairy products, especially cheese, a business he started a little more than 30 years ago when he became unemployed; he used to work for an important firm in the country.

He started off selling rice, oil and basic staple items in general and later on added selling cheese by the kilo to stores, commercial points and among regular customers that place orders with him because they are aware of the good quality Bernardo handles.  

His market expands more each time but Bernardo does not have enough working capital to inject into his business to grow more quickly which is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy groceries in larger amounts because he has several accounts receivable that prevent him from collecting in the short term and new customers placing orders that he finds difficult to fill in a timely way.

His investment will be successful because he’ll manage to finance his credit portfolio and respond rapidly to new customers which will strengthen his sales and his customer base even more.

His goal for later on is to have a commercial point and a vehicle to transport his orders.  We [FMSD] are sure that with persistent work and discipline, Bernardo will surely reach all his goals attaining more wellbeing each time.

loans.use: to buy groceries in larger amounts.

loans.name: Temitha Group

texts.en:
Sento is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sento was born in Makeni city about thirty-five years ago. She is married to a tailor, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Sento sells cooked foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots). She has been a businesswoman for five years now.
 
With the help of this loan, Sento and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. Sento will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy cooking ingredients like uncooked foo-foo, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, onions, tomatoes, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients like uncooked foo-foo, margi, pepper, onions, tomatoes, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en: When Phyllis was in 9th grade, she enrolled in an elective photography class which was the gateway to her passion for photography and design. Since then, Phyllis has been in photography for 15 years. “I decided to take that hobby and turn it into a career,” she says. Phyllis, age 45, with a Bachelor in Marketing, returned to school to complete her degree in Computers and Graphic Design. While in college, Phyllis obtained two internships: one in marketing and another working on computers. The marketing internship was not for her. “I would get off work and take time to photograph,” she says. Soon after, Phyllis received compliments. “Maybe someone is willing to pay me for this,” she thought. “I’m going to slowly build the program.” In January, Phyllis opened "PJE Multimedia" in Shreveport. Phyllis plans to assist other local businesses with creating and assembling their websites. Another aspect of Phyllis’ work is her ability to manipulate a photo to please clients. For example, she photographed an elementary class and, for one parent, Phyllis swapped her child, who was standing on the end, with the child who was standing front and center. However, Phyllis says she wants to focus more on web design and graphics until she can fully develop her photography business plan. When she photographs, Phyllis tries to capture the essence of her subject. “The purpose is to portray the photos as art,” she says. Phyllis advises her customers: “Tell me what’s on your mind, and if I can’t do it, I’ll tell you.” After attending a lecture on small business administration at Louisiana State University, Phyllis inquired about a loan from ACCION Texas Inc. instead of a traditional bank. Recently approved, she will use the loan to purchase a lighting kit which includes lights, a green screen background and a small black background for torso and head shots. The loan will also fund product research. Phyllis plans to work with another company to print her photos on shirts but she needs to know the shirts won’t wither after a couple of washes. “If a company is not up to par, I’ll switch companies,” she says. At the moment, Phyllis does not employ anyone else but she plans to contract a model to be on-call and pose in the shirts with her photos on them. “I don’t want to feel like I have to make a quarter,” she says. “I just want to make a picture and approach a client …. The money is nice, but the emotional reaction from clients is better.” For more information about PJE Multimedia, visit her website at: www.pjemultimedia.com.

loans.use: to purchase lights, a green screen and a small black backdrop for photos.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two children. 

For the past 12 years he has been working in the car services industry and has had his own business for car washing and lubrication. Recently, Karim diversified his sources of income and started trading carpets in his neighborhood.

Karim is applying for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a pick-up truck to transfer his products, mainly lubricants and carpets from the wholesaler to his shop and at times to the customers’ homes. Karim is always considering ways to expand his work activities and generate more income to raise the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck to transfer his products.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man and the father of three children. 

As his region, Baalbeck, is famous for its agricultural activity, Mohammad started his own cultivation business at the age of 17. Until today, he has been planting and selling fresh and organic apples, apricots, peaches, and plums. He also operates his tractor for plowing his and other’s lands.

Mohammad is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the money to register his van to operate it in transporting his produce to markets outside his area, such as Beirut. In selling his goods in the capital, Mohammad can generate more income than he would back in his hometown; consequently he would provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to register his van to operate it in transporting his produce to markets outside his area.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de unos repuestos para el vehículo, comprara la caja de velocidades, fricciones y llantas, esto le ayudara para mantener su carro en buenas condiciones, haciendole una buena inversion general.
Con el préstamo anterior logro terminar la compra de unos lotes donde construirá  para su familia, él ha mejorado su condición económica familiar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He would like to purchase a gearbox, brakes, and wheels, which will help him to keep his car running in good condition. This would be a good general investment for him.
With his previous loan, Ricardo finished purchasing a couple lots where he will build a home for his family. This loan has helped him to improve his family’s financial state.

loans.use: to purchase a gearbox, brakes, and wheels.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria, esta solicitando un préstamo para seguir trabajando en su negocio, comprara materia prima para hacer pupusas, maíz, aceite, condimentos, quesillo, chicharrones, con los que espera tener la oportunidad de crecer en las ventas y le ayude a generar mas ganancias.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, pues invirtio en los cosmeticos, ayudandole a tener una variedad para sus clientes tambien en la pupuseria conto con todo lo necesario para seguir ofreciendo pupusas a los clientes, mejorando su clientela y las ganancias a la familia.
texts.en:
Maria is asking for this loan to keep working on her business.  She will buy raw materials to make pupusas, such as corn, oil, condiments, cheese, and pork rinds, with which she hopes to have the opportunity to increase her sales and make more profits.

Her last loan had a very positive effect, as she invested it in cosmetics, which helped her have a variety to offer her customers, and it also helped her pupusa shop.  She was able to count on having everything she needed to keep selling her customers pupusas, which improved her clientele and her family's earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, condiments, cheese, and pork rinds

loans.name: Luisa Morena

texts.es:
Luisa, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de seguir en su negocio, ya que es su fuente de ingresos, quiere utilizar este préstamo en la compra de lociones, cosméticos de belleza como labiales, cremas,  maquillajes, que le incrementen la posibilidad de ganar dinero.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior le aumentaron las ventas y que su condición de vida está más solvente económicamente.
texts.en:
Luisa decided to ask for a new loan so that she can continue her business.  It is her source of income and she wants to use this loan to buy lotions and beauty products such as lipstick, creams, and makeup.  This will give her the opportunity to earn more money.

She says that with her previous loan, she increased her sales and can now meet her financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy lotions, lipsticks, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: John B.'s Group

texts.en:
These are the staff members of a reputable institution in Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. This hard-working and dedicated staff has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they repay their loans by using their monthly salaries. Their financial officer is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

John is the leader of this team. A native of Matamp village in northern Sierra Leone, the 48-year-old is married and has nine children attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. John has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. He will buy four bushels of rice seeds and pay labor. He will also use a part of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy four bushels of rice seeds, pay labor, and use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
Maritza, una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad, vive en un Barrio de San Pedro Sula junto a su pareja y sus 3 hijos y se ayudan mutuamente, su esposo con sus ahorros le apoyo para que iniciara un negocio, al ver la oportunidad ella decidió poner un puesto de venta de comida, ofreciendo desayunos, baleadas, pollos fritos y almuerzos y refrescos, aparte de vender comida, también se dedica al comercio vendiendo mercadería como un ingreso extra. 
Ahora con ODEF a solicitado un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para ampliar su servicios y vender también churros, dulces, jugos, pasteles etc. Además invertir en comprar alguna mercadería que le hace falta, e insumos para la venta de comida y de esta manera hacer rendir más el negocio, y que le generen más ingresos para el sostenimiento económico del hogar.
Manifiesta que esta agradecida con ODEF y KIVA por la ayuda adquirida y su meta principal es llegar a tener su propia casa para instalar allí su negocio para hacerlo crecer aun más.
texts.en:
Maritza is a hardworking, 30 year old woman living in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with her spouse and three children; they all help each other out.  Her husband used his savings to help her start a business.  She saw the opportunity to open a food stand selling breakfasts, ‘baleadas’ [stuffed flour tortillas], fried chicken, lunches and refreshments.  In addition to selling food she also sells general merchandise as a way of earning extra income.

She’s asking ODEF for a 15,000 lempira loan to expand her services and also sell snacks, candy, juice, cakes, etc. as well as to buy some merchandise she needs and ingredients needed to make her dishes so that the business will produce more and generate more income for her home’s economic support.

She states that she’s grateful to ODEF and KIVA for the help she’s gotten and her main goal is to have a house of her own to set up her business there and make it grow even more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, corn, firewood, cheese, gas, and condiments

loans.name: Dennis Osmin

texts.es:
Dennis tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad, vive en un barrio céntrico de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Dennis desde hace 10 años se dedica a trabajar dando el servicio de taxi. La ruta que el hace es del centro de la ciudad a los centros comerciales que existen en los alrededores de la misma. Dennis tiene mucha experiencia en este trabajo ya que siempre se ha dedicado a este rubro trabajando para otras personas. Fue entonces que decidió tener su propio taxi para generar sus propios ingresos, los cuales manifiesta son muy rentables. 
El lleva 2 prestamos con ODEF, ahora el necesita el tercer préstamo de 6,500 lempiras para compra de amortiguador para el taxi para seguir trabajando y dando un mejor servicio a los usuarios.
Su meta es seguir trabajando con mucho esfuerzo, lograr pagar por completo el taxi y tener una solvencia económica que respalde cualquier necesidad en el futuro.
texts.en:
Dennis, 36, is married and has two children who are 6 and 5 years old; he lives in a centrally located neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Dennis has worked providing taxi services for ten years.  His route is from downtown to shopping centers located around town.  Dennis has much experience in this line of work since he’s always worked at this for others.  Eventually, he decided to have a taxi of his own to generate his own income; he states that it’s very profitable.

He’s had two ODEF loans and now needs a third one for 6,500 lempiras to buy shock absorbers for his taxi so that he can continue working and giving good customer service.  His goal is to continue working very hard in order to pay off his taxi and attain economic solvency to be able to meet any future need.

loans.use: to buy shock absorbers for his taxi.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
Jose, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, tiene la oportunidad de comprarse dos novillas, un torete y una vaca, esto le ayudara a incrementar su hato ganadero, en un futuro podrá sacarle ganancia a esta compra.
El manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con su primer préstamo, que le aumentado su ganadería, cambiando sus condiciones familiares, generándole mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan to invest in the business; he has the opportunity of buying two heifers, a bullock and a cow which will help him increase his herd size.  In the future he’ll be able to benefit from this purchase.

He states that he had a good experience with his first loan because his cattle increased changing his family condition and generating better income.

loans.use: to buy two heifers, a bullock and a cow.

loans.name: Ingrid Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ingrid, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el negocio, invirtiendo en ropa nueva blusas, camisetas, ropa para niños, ropa interior, entre otros que son parte para atender la demanda.
Ella comenta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para surtir el negocio, sus ventas están estables y su familia se ha mantenido, ella continua con deseos de trabajar con prestamos para poderse superar en el comercio.
texts.en:
Ingrid is asking for a new loan to improve the business investing in new clothes like blouses, t-shirts, children’s clothes and underwear, among others to meet demand.

She comments that the previous loan helped her stock the business; her sales are stable and her family has been supported.  She continues with the desire to work with loans to be able to excel in business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, de 52 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 4 hijos, tres son mayores de edad, estando a su cargo solo el menor de sus hijos, ella realizo sus estudio hasta la secundaria, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, ella con el apoyo de créditos a logrado surtir su  negocio que le han permitido aumentar sus ingresos.  
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como artículos del hogar, platos y adornos de vidrios y cosméticos alusivos al mes de las madres, con el objetivo de mantener en su pulpería todos los productos que le solicita el cliente, ella espera como planes futuros cancelar el préstamo e invertir en mejorar la infraestructura del negocio.
texts.en:
Fifty-two-year-old Sandra is originally from Granada.  She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom are adults.  She still cares for the youngest of her children.  She has a secondary education and she is the shopkeeper of a small grocery store for a living.  With the help of loans, she has been able to stock her business, which has allowed her to increase her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy products such as household items, plates, glass ornaments, and cosmetics in keeping with the month of Mother's Day.  Her goal is to have all of the products her customers ask for in her market.  Her future plans are to pay off her loan and invest in improving her business' infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy products such as household items, plates, glass ornaments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un préstamo para la compra de mas inventario para el negocio, pues quiere tener surtido de productos frescos, comprándose papas, zanahorias, güisquiles, mangos, papayas, sandia, además comprara ropa usada para tener a la venta.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para que sus ventas se incrementaran y ampliar el negocio surtiendolo de ropa y frutas, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y espera seguir creciendo y prosperando.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy stock for her business as she wants to have a range of fresh products. She will buy potatoes, carrots, pear squashes, mangoes, papayas and watermelons, as well as second-hand clothes to sell. 

She says that the previous loan helped her to increase her sales and to expand the business by stocking it with clothes and fruit. Her economic situation has improved and she hopes to continue expanding and prospering.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, pear squashes, mangoes, papayas, watermelons and clothes.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
MARIA FERNANDA tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad vive con el esposo y con y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

 MARIA FERNANDA se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de frutas. Solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, barilla, eternit.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar el mejoramineto de vivienda . Las compras las realizará en Guaranda.
El sueño es poder educar a los hijos.

 Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es trabajar duro para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los hijos y arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Fernanda is 32 years old, is married and has two children who are 6 and 4 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Maria Fernanda earns her living selling all sorts of different fruits. She is asking for a loan to buy cement, soda ash and eternit brand fibre-reinforced cement. With the loan she will be able to improve her home. She will buy the products in Guaranda. 

Her dream is to be able to give her children an education.The challenge she faces is to work hard to improve her living conditions. In her free time she enjoys looking after her children and spending time fixing-up her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, soda ash and eternit brand fibre-reinforced cement.

loans.name: Manuel Mercedes

texts.es:
