Furteliana works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase pig feed and ingredients for peanut rolls. She hopes to start a sari-sari store business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and ingredients for peanut rolls

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is 31 years old, married, with 2 children ages 4 and 7. Tita's husband is also a farmer.

Tita grows rice crops to sell. She does her best to keep their farm productive. She also makes sure her family eats 3 times a day and is in good health. 

Tita is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and repair their thresher. Tita hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes to elevate her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and repair their thresher

loans.name: Grafort

texts.en:
Grafort is 47 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 8 children.

Grafort works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 23 years. He has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase more stock to sell.

Grafort has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: La Sra. Julieta  tiene 45 años y es casada, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, ella vende variedad de platillos en su pensión que se encuentra en la zona de tembladerani,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Julieta va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para refaccionar el local de expendio de comida, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar la imagen del negocio, la Sra. Julieta enfrenta retos en su negocio que son trasladarse a una zona más comercial y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando sus instalaciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Julieta is 45 years old and married. She sells food, which consists of a variety of dishes offered from her eatery that is located in the District of Tembladerani. This loan is her fourth cycle with Emprender. Sra. Julieta will use the money to buy construction materials for remodeling the place where she sells food. Her reason for requesting this loan is to improve the image of her business.

Sra. Julieta faces challenges in her business, such as moving to a more commercial area. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she can continue improving her facilities.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for remodeling her business.

loans.name: Lord Denney

texts.en:
Lord Denney is 29 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 1 child. 

Lord Denney has a fish pond business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to build a new hut in his fish pond area. 

Lord Denney has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, he hopes to acquire his own fish pond.

loans.use: To build a new hut in his fish pond area

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Ayda tiene 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además es muy atenta y amable con las personas. Vive con Raúl, quien se dedica a la extracción de madera y es el padre de sus dos hijas; Greysi de 17 y Andrea de 15 años de edad. La casa donde viven es propia.

La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de mercadería variada como joyería, ropa y productos de belleza, todos de buena calidad y modelos variados, a la moda. Su mercadería es adquirida en sus viajes a la capital y la vende desde su propia casa, ofreciendo también a sus vecinas y amistades, a quienes trata de manera amable y cordial, ganándose su preferencia y éstos la recomiendan con otras personas.
Decidió empezar con este negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos, ya que le faltaba cubrir algunas necesidades. Fue hace más de 2 años que lo logró con un capital prestado por MFP, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola, pero ocasionalmente le apoya su pareja en buscar nuevos clientes. Considera a su negocio rentable, por las ganancias que le deja y le sirven para solventar sus gastos y la educación de sus hijas. 
Ahora, viendo las ganancias que le deja, desea invertir en abrir una tienda donde venda todos sus productos, planea implementarla en su misma casa.

Éste es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Por eso tiene el compromiso de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa variada y joyería para vender en su casa. Buscará precios cómodos para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ayda is 34 years old and is a hard-working and determined woman.  She is also very kind and amiable with people.  She lives with Raul, who works in forestry and is the father of her two daughters:  Greysi, age 17, and Andrea, age 15.  They own the home in which they live.

Her job is selling a variety of merchandise such as jewellery, clothing and beauty products, all of good quality and in a variety of fashionable styles.  Her merchandise is acquired through her trips to the capital, and she sells it from her home to her neighbors and friends. She treats them in a friendly and cordial way, and they recommend her to other people.

She decided to start this business because she needed more income to meet her needs, as she was unable to pay for certain necessities.  She was able to do this more than 2 years ago with the help of a loan from MFP.  Until now she has been doing it alone, although her partner helps her sometimes in seeking new clients.  She considers her business to be profitable, because her earnings from it help to pay bills and to educate her daughters.  Now, seeing the income that she has earned, she wants to invest in opening a store in her home, where she can sell her products.  This is her second loan with MFP.  Because of this she commits to making her payments so as to have a good credit record.  With the amount requested, 4000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying a variety of clothing and jewellery to sell in her house.  She will seek out good prices so as to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus tres hijos, es madre soltera, administra una tienda de la cual logra obtener los recursos para el alimento de sus hijos, este negocio surgió por su madre, quien le aconsejo dedicarse a la venta de productos domésticos, lo tiene en su casa de habitación, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, sal, frijoles, refrescos, gaseosas, esto le ayudara para mejorar el inventario, para crecer y poder ofrecer a los clientes lo necesario.
Su objetivo es trabajar arduamente para poder obtener su propia casa, apoyar a sus hijos para que se preparen académicamente, y poder tener una familia unida con éxito en sus negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother and lives with her three children. She manages a store in order to generate income to feed her children. This business was suggested to her by her mother, who advised her to sell household products. Ana's store is in her home and she does not have a set schedule.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as rice, sugar, salt, beans, soft drinks, and sodas. This will improve her inventory, thus allowing her to grow and offer her customers what they need. Her goal is to work hard so that she can acquire a house of her own, help her children prepare academically, and have a close family as a result of a successful business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, salt, beans, soft drinks, and sodas.

loans.name: Exaltacion Group

texts.es: La señora Hilda tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada, su esposo es albañil, ella tiene 3 hijos una mujer y dos hombres, todos mayores de edad ya trabajan, ella estudio hasta la secundaria, ella vende en el mercado regalos y artículos de arreglo para dama y niñas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar pulseras, anillos, aretes, esclavas, muñecos de peluche, alhajeros, vasos, jarros, vajillas, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años porque le gusta vender y convivir con las personas, su negocio es importante porque le proporciona ingresos para la familia, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su negocio le puede ayudar a sus hijos en algo que necesiten,ampliar su casa hizo un cuarto, ella utiliza las ganancia para invertir en su negocio , para pagar su crédito y para ir ahorrando. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio vender hilos, agujas y estambres. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener una mercería grande bien establecida y que sus hijos se superen y vivan bien, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir por la oportunidad  que tiene de surtir su negocio, ella le va a echar ganas al negocio para que crezca. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por su confianza que nos brindan, con su ayuda podemos crecer los negocios, gracias por ayudar a la gente que más lo necesitamos".
texts.en:
Hilda is forty-three years old and married. Her husband is a builder. She has three children: one girl and two boys, all working adults. She studied through high school and now sells gifts and accessories for women and girls in the market. She is requesting a loan to buy bracelets, rings, earrings, bangles, stuffed toys, jewel cases, glasses, pitchers, and dishware.

Hilda started her business seven years ago because she likes sales and being with people. Her business is important because it provides money for her family. She is proud to have a business that enables her to help her children with whatever they need, and to expand her house—she added a room. She uses her earnings to invest in her business, to pay her credit, and to save money. She is planning to expand her business to sell thread, needles, and worsted yarn.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a well-established notions store, and that her children improve themselves and live well. She is happy that on receiving this loan, she will have the opportunity to supply her business. She is going to throw herself into the business to make it grow. 

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad "thank you for the confidence that you give us. With your help we can grow our businesses. Thank you for helping the people who most need it."

loans.use: to buy bracelets, rings, earrings, gifts, bangles, stuffed toys, purses, glasses, pitchers, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Franci

texts.es:
Franci tiene 42 años, vive con Bertha, con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos que aún estudian. Él y su familia viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Rosa en Chanchamayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con un terreno de 600 metros cuadrados, donde siembra plátanos, yucas y frutos cítricos. También cuenta con 15 parcelas que no producen pero espera tener el dinero para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y demás insumos. "Estoy pensando sembrar café y cacao, porque los precios son buenos", menciona como meta a corto plazo. 
Lleva casi 10 años en este trabajo y le gusta hacerse cargo de sus cultivos, pues le distrae salir al campo y organizar su producción al aire libre.
Con esta actividad pudo darles educación a sus 3 hijos mayores que ya no viven con él, y lo continúa haciendo con los 3 menores. 
Su propósito a futuro es ampliar su producción, mejorar sus ventas y velar por su familia bajo un techo decente y con las necesidades básicas cubiertas.

Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso da su palabra de que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas. Afirma que le agrada el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", por la organización y confianza dentro del grupo.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en el pago de los servicios de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos de plátanos, yucas y naranjas.
texts.en:
Franci is 42 years old and lives with Bertha. They have six children, but only three live with them since they are still students. Franci and his family live in their own home in the indigenous community of Santa Rosa in Chanchamayo.

He is a farmer and has a plot of land that measures 600 square meters, where he has planted bananas, cassava, and citrus fruits. He also has 15 parcels of land that are not producing, but he hopes to have the money to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies. "I intend to plant coffee and cacao because the prices are good," Franci says of his short-term goal.

He has been in this line of work for almost 10 years and enjoys taking charge of his crops. Franci keeps himself occupied by going out into the field and organizing his crops out in the open. Through his business, he was able to provide an education for his three grown children who are no longer living with him. He continues to do the same for the three younger ones. His future goals include increasing his production, improving his sales, and providing his family with a decent home with all of the basic necessities.

This is his eighth loan with MFP. Franci gives his word that he will submit his payments on time. He signed an agreement to work with his Communal Bank "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" (The Little Roses of Ubiriki) because his group is organized and trustworthy. Franci will invest the money he requested in the payment for services provided by workers, who will be hired to clear his fields for planting bananas, cassava, and oranges.

loans.use: to hire workers to clear his farmland.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su centro parroquial se mezcla entre lo antiguo y lo moderno, tiene grandes lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es trabajadora, luchadora, laboran en la agricultura, comercio y cría de animales, muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad.

La Señora María tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados, uno de ellos vive independiente y el otro vive en su casa, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como  pasa  la mayor parte del tiempo en casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, borregos y ganado que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También se dedica a la agricultura y lo quie cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, borregos y alimento para animales.
 
Su meta es crecer en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Commuanl Bank "Cochapamba". She lives in a neighboring community in the parish of El Valle in Cuenca. This parish experiences cold weather and its central area is a mixture of the ancient and the modern. There are large spaces where one can enjoy the natural beauty. The people are hardworking and determined individuals who engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. Many also have day jobs in the city.

Sra. María is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are married, one lives independently and the other lives at home. Her single child works and helps out financially. María's husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They own the home in which they live.

Doña María is in charge of the household chores, but most of her time at home is spent raising chickens, sheep, and cattle. The animals are sold whenever she has a financial need. She also farms, but her harvest is only for household consumption.

Doña María has been a member of her Communal Bank for two years. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens, sheep, and feed for these animals. Her goal is to grow her animal breeding business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, sheep, and animal feed.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 and lives in Taguig City, the Philippines. She is married to Marcelo, a collector at the south station, and they have three children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish wholesale and sells them by the kilo. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. There are many customers who prefer Gina’s products because of their freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community, who look forward to Gina's fish. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more fish to sell and she expects a boost to her income as she expands her business. Gina hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with the other members of her fellowship to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Señorita María  tiene 21 años y soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de api y pasteles en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de cruce villa Copacabana, ella está en su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Señorita María va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como azúcar y harina para la elaboración de sus riquísimo api (el api es una refresco liquida hecha de maíz blanco y morado generalmente se acompaña con pasteles con queso),  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar el negocio, María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias personas que venden api por la zona, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando y creciendo en su negocio. María es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Srta. María is 21 years old and single. She sells "api" and pastries from her vending stall in the District of Cruce Villa Copacabana. This is her fifth loan cycle with Emprender. Srta. María will use the money to buy supplies, such as sugar and flour, for preparing the delicious "api" (a refreshing drink made from white and purple corn that is generally served with cheese pastries).

Her reason for requesting this loan is to expand her business. María confront challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition since there are several vendors in the area who sell "api". By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will continue to improve and grow in her business. María is a hardworking and enterprising young woman who is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and other supplies.

loans.name: Susana Gabriela

texts.es:
La Señorita Susana es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su centro parroquial se mezcla entre lo antiguo y lo moderno, tiene grandes lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es trabajadora, luchadora, laboran en la agricultura, comercio y cría de animales, muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad.

La Señorita. Susana tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es chofer profesional y su mamá se dedica al comercio. 

Nuestra socia se dedica hace un año a la venta de cosméticos, labora todos los días sin horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año pero ahora se encuentra ingresando a otro banco comunal. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para tener mayor variedad.
 
Su meta es de continuar con sus estudios Universitarios y llegar a ser una buena profesional en Psicología.
texts.en:
Srta. Susana is a member of the Commuanl Bank "Cochapamba". She lives in a neighboring community in the parish of El Valle in Cuenca. This parish experiences cold weather and its central area is a mixture of the ancient and the modern. There are large spaces where one can enjoy the natural beauty. The people are hardworking and determined individuals who engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. Many also have day jobs in the city.

Srta. Susana is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her father is a professional driver and her mother is a merchant. Susana has been selling cosmetics for one year. She works every day, but without a set schedule.

Susana has been a member of a Communal Bank for one year, but now she is joining another Communal Bank. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics so that she will have more variety. Her goal is to continue her university studies and become a successful professional in the field of psychology.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, vive en su propia casa, con su familia conformada por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, José trabaja la agricultura desde hace 9 años, lo aprendió de su padre, con esto ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Actualmente está iniciando su labor en la nueva siembra, solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como abono, semilla, y otros fertilizantes que usa para este trabajo, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de conseguir los insumos necesarios, poder tener una buena producción.
El objetivo de José es que su trabajo sea provechoso, para crecer en la economía de la familia, apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home with his family, which consists of his wife and two young children. He has worked as a farmer for nine years and learned the trade from his father. Through his business, he has been able to sustain his family.

José is currently starting a new planting season. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies such as compost, seeds, and other fertilizers to use in his work. This loan will provide him the opportunity to secure necessary supplies so that he can have a good production. His goals are to perform profitable work, grow his family's finances, and support his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Olga Maria  esta emprendedora es casada con tres hijos menores de edad, ella tiene varios años de trabajar con Fundación  León 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser honrada, trabajadora, con solvencia moral, en la actualidad ella ha podido hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación  gracias al financiamiento que  fundación león 2000 le ha brindado de esta forma ha podido cumplir sus sueños y metas establecida para la mejor estabilidad de ella y su familia. El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, cal, zinc, pintura entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga Maria is an entrepreneur who is married and has three young children. She has worked many years with Fundación León 2000 and has demonstrated that she is honest, hardworking, and morally competent. At the moment, she is making improvements to her home. Thanks to the financing provided by Fundación León 2000, she has been able to fulfill the dreams and goals that she has established for herself and her family.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, lime, zinc, paint, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, lime, zinc, paint, and other materials.

loans.name: Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Elisabeth est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est la responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes. Elisabeth s'approvisionne en céréales, liqueurs et divers à Cotonou et dans le marché de sa ville. En vue d'améliorer le niveau de vie de leurs enfants, supporter les charges et agrandir son commerce, Elisabeth a sollicité, ensemble avec sa coéquipière un crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 37 years old, married and mother of one child. She is in charge of a group of two persons. Elisabeth stocks up with cereal, liqueurs and miscellaneous items in Cotonou and in her city's market.

To improve the standard of living of her children, handle her responsibilities and expand her business, Elisabeth requested a credit loan from Finadev, together with her co-team member.

The person in charge is the one on the left of the photo.

loans.use: 1 carton of liqueurs, 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of corn, 1 carton of spaghetti and 1 carton of canned goods.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is married with eight children. Gertrudes is 61 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Gertrudes sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Gertrudes has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 34 años, vive con Victoria, con quien tiene 4 hijos que aún estudian. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Rosa de Ubiriki en Chanchamayo.

A su corta edad ya trabajaba en los terrenos de cultivos de sus padres, así aprendió sobre la actividad agrícola, con la que actualmente mantiene a su familia. Cuenta con un lote de terreno en el que siembra yucas, cítricos, plátanos y achiote. “Todos los productos son rentables, solo hay que saber negociar”, comenta. Además cuenta que el año pasado cosechó 8000 kilos de achiote, cada kilo lo vendió a 5 soles, obteniendo buenas ganancias, que el permitieron seguir sembrando. Pablo obtiene otros ingresos para sus gastos diarios, trabajando como jornalero en otros terrenos. La mayor parte de su producción la comercializa en el mercado de frutas de las ciudades aledañas. Ahí llegan compradores de varias ciudades, quienes pagan un precio justo por sus cosechas. Uno de sus futuros propósitos es adquirir más terrenos para ampliar sus cultivos de achiote y yuca.

Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Por otra parte, se siente contento de tener socios responsables dentro de su banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki”.
Con este préstamo, Pablo podrá pagar a los jornaleros, quienes limpiarán sus terrenos de la mala hierba que afecta el normal crecimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Pablo is 34 years old and lives with Victoria. They have four children who are in school. They live in their own home in the indigenous community of Santa Rosa de Ubiriki in Chanchamayo.

At a young age, Pablo worked on his parents' farmland and learned the trade in this manner. He now utilizes his experience to support his family. Pablo has a plot of land on which he grows cassava, citrus fruits, bananas, and annatto. "All of these products are profitable, but only if you know how to negotiate," says Pablo. Last year he harvested 8,000 kilos of annatto, each kilo selling for 5 PEN. He generated good earnings, which enabled him to continue planting. Pablo earns extra income for his daily expenses by working as a laborer on other farms. A large portion of his production is sold at the fruit markets in neighboring cities. When the buyers from different cities arrive, he gets paid a fair price for his harvest. One of his future goals is to acquire more land so that he can expand his annatto and cassava crops.

This will be his eighth loan with MFP and Pablo gives his word that he will be punctual with his loan payments. In addition, he is pleased that the members of his Communal Bank, "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" (The Little Roses of Ubiriki), are responsible. With this loan, Pablo will pay his workers to clear his land of weeds that could affect the normal growth of his plants.

loans.use: to pay workers to clear his land of weeds.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 43 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

Carolina works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Carolina has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Carolina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, ages 12, 7 and 5. She is involved in farming and primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also runs a motorcycle rental business. Victoria requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and motorcycle spare parts. She hopes for her income to increase so she could provide for her family's basic needs and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en:
Rosabella is 45 years old and lives in Taguima,Tudela. Rosabella is married with three children.

Rosabella has a mini salon business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Rosabella has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional beauty products.

Rosabella has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Rosabella hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a thirty-seven-year-old married man. He runs a retail shop and this has facilitated him paying school fees for his children. He started by buying maize for other people thus acting as a middle-man then raised capital and started his own business. His dream is to educate his children and expand the business into new markets. Alfred wants a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 38-year-old married woman. She has five children, ages ranging from 22 to 12 years old. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as kale, cabbages, tomatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a fast-growing market and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for expanding the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to run a bigger grocery store within five years. Eunice hopes that in the future, she will use the the profits generated to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is forty-two years old, and a married father of six children who lives in Hioma, Uganda. He is a farmer and he has been farming for four years now. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and seasonal weather variance. His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes to diversify his business to include a retail shop. Felix intends to use the loan to hire labor and buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to hire labor and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: St Yowanina Group

texts.en:
Mary is a fifty-five year old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has had a retail shop business for fifteen years. Her hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock and customers not paying on time. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. Her business goal is to buy land to grow crops.

Mary wants money to buy sugar, soap, baking powder and salt. She is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, baking powder and salt to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is thirty-two years old, married, with four children. He has a business buying and selling local gin, commonly known as kasese. He faces challenges of high transport and fuel fluctuations plus seasonal variations. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. He wishes to buy land for farming and to move his business to a more permanent location. He intends to use the loan to purchase local gin.

loans.use: to purchase local gin.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a thirty-two-year-old married man. He has two children aged six and ten. He describes himself as honest and social. He operates a retail store  where he sells home products such as rice, sugar, flour etc. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located near a university and his primary customers are students and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenges to be delay of payments from the customers and high transportation costs. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy home products. Previously, Douglas had taken a loan of KES 20,000 which he managed to pay back completely. His business goal is to expand his business by running another retail shop. He hopes that in the future, he will use the profits generated from the business to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 31-year-old single mother of 3 children living in Masindi,Uganda. She sells clothes and shoes and she has been in this business for 7 years now. She is challenged by inadequate capital. Her family goal is to educate her children and she hopes to expand the business into new markets. Harriet intends to use the loan to  buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. He started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. Business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding his business into new markets and hiring employees to help expand the business. Shaban wants money to buy a fridge so as to preserve the perishable items.

loans.use: to buy a fridge so as to preserve the perishable items.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 32-year-old married woman with five children living in Masindi,Uganda. For the last two years, she has been dealing in cattle raising. Her dream is to educate her children and expand the business into a ranch. Inadequate capital hinders her business since it requires a lot of manpower and feed. Jovia wants a loan to buy cows to raise.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a twenty-six-year-old hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. While still a student he saved the pocket money given to him by his parents to buy a camera for photography. The business has now grown since every Saturday he gets contracts to take photographs at weddings. His dream is to build a permanent home, buy a car and set up a modern studio. Geofrey wants a loan to buy materials to build his residential house.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is forty-nine years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Emma has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Emma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Karine lives with her husband, and thanks to their different occupations they can provide for themselves. Karine is engaged in a trading business and also in animal breeding in Geghamavan village, in the area of Sevan. Karine rents a stall where she sells food, stationery and toys. She buys merchandise for her shop from local suppliers. Simultaneously Karine rears cows and sheep with her husband's support. As their farm is not big they generally use the dairy products and meat they produce for their own needs. 

Karine wants to enlarge the assortment of goods in her shop so she is asking for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy various soft toys, dolls and large number of copybooks, pens, pencils, markers, etc. to resell. Karine says that toys and stationery are always in popular demand so she is sure that she will sell that merchandise in a short time.

loans.use: to buy soft toys, dolls and large number of copybooks, pens, pencils and markers to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 29-year-old single mother of 3 children living in Masindi, Uganda. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the last ten years. She is challenged by high fuel and transportation costs and theft. Her family goal is to educate her children and build a permanent home. She hopes to hire employees to help expand the business and have outlets in different trading centers. Sarah needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis wants a loan to weed and buy fertilizers for his farm. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 40 years, married, with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. Having saved from his salary, Francis bought the land on which he farms. His dream is to educate his children and expand the business to new markets. He also intends to hire employees to help in business expansion. Seasonal weather, price fluctuations and inflation affect his business.

loans.use: to weed and buy fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has three children whose ages range from one to twenty. She describes herself as aggressive and determined. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a fast growing market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bags of charcoal. This is her first loan. Purity's dream and business goal is to be a charcoal distributor within five years.

loans.use: to get additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: St Theresa Women Group

texts.en:
Ndere is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house and buy a car. His business goals are to diversify his business, buy land to grow crops and move his business to a more permanent location.

Ndere wants money to buy clothes to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret wants a loan to buy iron sheets and doors for her house. She is aged forty-seven and is a widow living in Masindi, Uganda.The responsibility of taking care of four children solely rests on her. She started with capital worth UGX 70,000 and now has 2,000,000 Uganda shillings as working capital. 

She operates a salon and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children and start construction of her house. She desires to educate her children and expand her business into new areas despite challenges including inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and doors for her house.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est mariée à un mécanicien. Elle a 03 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Elle est revendeuse de sucre, d’huile et de maïs à la maison. Elle est à son premier  crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut avoir une boutique et souhaite que ses enfants fassent de longues études.
texts.en: Afi is married to a mechanic and has three children, two of whom are at school. She retails sugar, oil and corn from home. She is on her first loan from WAGES and is requesting the loan to buy goods so that she can better satisfy customer demand. She would like to have a shop and also wants her children to do lengthy studies.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Ruyubake Group

texts.fr: La cliente femme dynamique, entrepreneur,  âgée de 39ans est  présidente de l’association d’affaire  ruyubake. Mère de 7enfants  tous scolarisés  et mariée à un homme sans emploi. Elle vendeuse de haricot depuis  sa  jeunesse  et  est  au 6ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 7 sacs de haricots. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir  et finir leurs études. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de la femme pauvre à faible revenu.
texts.en: The customer is a dynamic lady and entrepreneur who is 39 years old and president of the Ruyubake business association. She is mother to seven children, who are all at school, and married to an unemployed man. She has been selling beans since she was young and is on her sixth loan from Hekima. This new loan will be used to stock up with seven sacks of beans. She wants to see her children grow up and finish their studies. She is thus grateful to Hekima for its actions in favour of poor women with low incomes.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of beans.

loans.name: Assaba

texts.fr: Assaba est mariée à un retraité. Elle a des enfants et est âgée de 56ans. Comme activité, elle fait l’élevage de poules à domicile. Une personne l’aide dans cette activité. Elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de WAGES pour acheter des poussins et des nourritures pour élever les poussins. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en ouvrant un autre poulailler afin de mieux agrandir sa clientèle. Elle veut construire sa propre maison et assurer la scolarité et l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en: Assaba is married to a pensioner. She has children and is 56 years old. She has a business raising chickens from home. One other person helps her with this business. She is requesting this third loan from WAGES to buy chickens and food to raise them. She wants to reinvest in the business by opening another chicken house so that she can expand her customer base more easily. She would like to build her own house and be able to provide for her children's education and future.

loans.use: to buy chicken and food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La client est une femme entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 8 enfants. Son mari est un enseignant dans une ecole publique de Bukavu. La cliente est vendeuse de farine de manioc. Elle installe ses marchandises devant son domicile. Elle est membre du groupe Ruyuba Kadutu et sollicite un nouveau crédit pour lui permettre d’accroître sa micro entreprise en s’approvisionnant avec 2 sacs de farine. Les intérêts du crédit lui permettront de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants, les nourrir et de le vêtir. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir pensé aux femmes pauvres exclues de la banque classique. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé en main.
texts.en: The client is a female entrepreneur who is 36 years old and mother to eight children. Her husband is a teacher in a public school in Bukavu. The customer sell manioc flour and set up her goods in front of her house. She is a member of the Ruyuba Kadutu group and is requesting a new loan so that she can expand her micro-business by stocking up with two sacks of flour. The interest of a loan is to enable her to pay for her children's school fees, as well as to feed and clothe them. She thanks Hekima for thinking of poor women who are excluded from classic banks. It should be noted that one of the customers is carrying her baby in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr: La cliente est une femme mariée  et dynamique. Elle est âgée  de 40 ans et assume la fonction de  secrétaire dans son  groupe de crédit Baraka. Elle est  au  au 13ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima.  Elle compte acheter  100 paires de souliers avec le crédit sollicité  pour la croissance  de son affaire. Elle remercie Hekima pour ces prêts et prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en: The customer, Wabiwa is a married woman who is dynamic. She is 40 years old and has the function of secretary within the Baraka loan group. She is on her 13th loan from Hekima. She is planning to buy 100 pairs of shoes with the requested loan so that she can grown her business. She thanks Hekima for these loans and prays to God to give it his blessing.

loans.use: to buy 100 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. She is aged thirty-four and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her three children. She sells clothes and she got her initial capital from her husband. She desires to educate her children, buy a motorcycle and diversify her business to include farming. Price fluctuations, inflation and thieves hinder her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is fifty-four years old and married with ten children. He has a retail shop and he started the business with the saving from tobacco sales, a business he initially dealt in. Despite the challenges of inadequate capital, his dream is to educate his children, buy a car and buy land to grow crops. 

Muhammad wants a loan to buy match boxes, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy match boxes, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Yoweri

texts.en:
Yoweri is a fifty-two-year-old married man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children to degree-level as a minimum qualification. He has been in the transport business for the last five years. He started as a hired driver and now has his own motorcycle. His main hardship is high fuel and transportation costs, however, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming.

Yoweri needs a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for three years and she is so proud of her profession. Her personal goal is to build a permanent house and educate her children.

Anna wants money to buy building materials for her residential house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her residential house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a community development worker for three years and reaching out to the poor has always been her passion. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. Ruth wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Bidodo

texts.en: Bidodo is a 49-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for 25 years, and he is still proud of his profession despite the low pay. His personal goal is to educate children and set up an income-generating activity. Bidodo wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a thirty-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda.He is a banker and has been in service for four years. He has a challenge to meet his needs due to his low salary. His personal goal is self-education and his business dream is to set up an internet cafe.

Julius intends to pay school fees for himself with the loan facility.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Kibaya

texts.en:
Kibaya is a 36-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for four years. 

Kibaya acquired capital from selling coffee worth 700,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. Kibaya wants money to buy paraffin, sugar, dry cells (batteries), soap, airtime and cooking oil to sell.

His business goals are to expand his business into new markets and move the business to a more permanent location. Kibaya's personal goals are to educate children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy paraffin, sugar, dry cells, soap, airtime and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is a fifty-one-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling eggs for one year. He started by selling ten trays in a month and now has forty five trays. The main hardships he faces are high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding his business into new markets.

Silver wants money to buy eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a forty-seven-year-old woman, she is married and a mother of two sons. She is a school teacher who gets a low salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay their education expenses. 

Nawal's son is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Nawal wants to help her son to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her son cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for her son and improve the family's living conditions. Nawal is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for her son.

loans.name: Wangninagbe 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE 4 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un plombier du nom de Yves. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont deux enfants sont à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans, Marie vend des assiettes, des glacières et de l'igname dans un marché du Benin. Marie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Marie désire obtenir un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE 4. Les trois crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Wangninagbe 4 group is made up of 3 people who live in the same district and belong to the same mutual funds group. The group's representative, Marie, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. The is the 4th time that the group requests ALIDé's financial support with a view to raising the level of their business.

Marie is 37 years old and is married to a plumber called Yves. The couple have 4 children, 2 of whom are in their charge. All the children have been to, or are attending, school. Marie herself did not go to school. She has been selling plates, iceboxes and yams at a market in Benin for almost 4 years. She gets her supplies in a town in Benin.

In order to increase her inventory and better respond to customer demand, Marie wishes to obtain a 4th loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Wangninagbe 4 group. The 3 loans previously received have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils (iceboxes, plates, etc.)

loans.name: Umvikane Group

texts.fr:
Evelyne fait partie du groupe Umvikane et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  est âgée de 32 ans et est marié à Elie, un peintre. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants, âgés  de  7 à 10 ans, tous étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de tomate, manioc,... oignons depuis 15ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de tomates, manioc, oignons,…à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Evelyne is a member of the Umvikane group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and married to Elie, a painter. The couple have 2 children together, aged 7 and 10, who both study.

Evelyne has been selling produce including tomatoes, onions and cassavas for 15 years. She is on her 2nd loan with Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored credit will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of tomatoes, cassavas, onions and other produce for resale, so that she can earn more. In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cassavas, onions, etc.

loans.name: Mahuklo 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Eugénie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Eugénie est mariée à un certain Claude. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eugénie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Eugénie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Eugénie vend depuis trois ans, des tissus et de façon secondaire des friperies de manière ambulante. Eugénie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir ses activités, Eugénie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mahuklo 1 is a group composed of 3 members who are friends and live in the same district of Benin. The group's representative, Eugénie (whose hand is raised in the picture) is 42 years old.  She is married to Claude and the couple have 5 dependent children who all go to school. Eugénie lives together with her husband and children and the couple both take care of the various household responsibilities and expenses.

Eugénie did not go to school. To be able to meet her various responsibilities, she has been a street vendor of fabrics and, as a sideline business, second hand clothing, for 3 years. She gets her supplies in a town in Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and with a view to expanding her business, Eugénie is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of Mahuklo 1. This loan will enable them to better respond to customer demand and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and second hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise and repair her roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase Omnilife natural products.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old married man from Gaza. He owns a small plot of land on which he raises rabbits. He has five years of experience in this activity, and this month he obtained a Startup Youth Loan from Ryada to begin working independently.

Mohammad works with his wife and one other employee on their new farm, and they have big dreams for the future. Through this loan and hard work, they hope to increase their stock of rabbits so that they can begin to work with distributors. Mohammad and his wife are working to increase their family income and improve their standard of living. The purpose of this loan is to buy an incubator and rabbit enclosures.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy an incubator and rabbit enclosures for his farm.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos; Marvin de 24, Karen de 22 y Marlon de 10 años de edad; además de un nietecito de 2 añitos.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso cuenta con una bodega que instaló en su propia vivienda, acondicionando un espacio donde acomodó su mercadería. Inició hace más de 4 meses este negocio con un préstamo bancario, pero el negocio principalmente lo atiende su hija, pues ella tiene un empleo donde brinda servicio de limpieza a un banco de su localidad. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable, pues sus productos son de primera necesidad y tienen salida a diario, dando una rotación constante a su capital. Además, con su trato y amabilidad, ella y su hija han sabido ganarse la preferencia de sus vecinos.
Antes de empezar con su actividad, no tenía problemas económicos, pero sí los deseos de generar un ingreso adicional para mejorar su economía y darle una ocupación a su hija, viendo esta oportunidad en su barrio, ya que no hay bodegas en la zona. 
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene deseos de continuar con el negocio y aumentar su stock de mercadería. 

Éste es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores, de esa manera tener acceso a otros créditos en el futuro.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general para surtir su negocio, así sus productos serán variados y estarán disponibles para la venta.
texts.en:
Sofía, 45, is a hardworking and enterprising woman who, in addition to being nice and friendly, is very eager to get ahead.  She is separated from the father of her children and lives in her own house with her three children, Marvin who is 24, Karen who is 22 and Marlon who is 10 years old.  She also has a granddaughter who is two years old.  

Sofía works selling groceries staples in a store located in her home.  She set up a space where she could accommodate her merchandise.  She started this business more than four months ago with a bank loan.  Her daughter mainly looks after the store since Sofía has a job providing cleaning services to a bank in her town.  She considers her business quite profitable since her products are staples and people need to buy them every day, giving her capital a constant rotation.  Additionally, with their kindness and good treatment, she and her daughter have earned the preference of their neighbors.   

Before starting this store, she did not have financial problems, but she wanted to generate additional income to improve her financial situation and give her daughter a job.  She saw an opportunity in her neighborhood, since there were no bodegas in that area.  Seeing the good results that she is having, she wants to continue with the business and increase her stock of merchandise.  

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have the financial support to advance her business.  She promises to be responsible with her payments, as she has been with her previous loans, so that she will be able to have access to other loans in the future.  

With the loan requested for 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase groceries to stock her store, so that her products will be varied and ready to be sold.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Wilson Aroldo

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre muy trabajador, con el fruto de su trabajo poco a poco ha ido saliendo adelante y sobre todo apoyando a su familia, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito d e Parcona, este distrito se caracteriza porque en él se desarrolla la agricultura, también se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. A Wilson le gusta hacer deporte y uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, y también en ocasiones aprovecha para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica”.

Con todo el entusiasmo que lo caracteriza Wilson trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el dia; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y hay mucha necesidad de movilizarse de los pobladores de su barrio.

Wilson está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, como revisión del motor del vehículo, de esta manera el manejara un vehículo en optimas condiciones y podrá conducir con mayor seguridad tanto para los clientes como para él; así el podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una flota de Taxis”.
texts.en:
Wilson is a very hard-working man. With the fruit of his work gradually he has been getting ahead and, above all, supporting his family. His house is located in the district of Parcona. This district is known because in it agriculture is developed. Also, it is known for the friendlyness of its population. Wilson likes to play spots and one of his favorite pastimes is to play football with his neighbors and friends in his neighborhood and also, on occasion, he takes advantage of eating one of his favorite dishes, which is the delicious "Ceviche." He only completed high school but he would have liked to study Mechanical Engineering.

With all of the enthusiasm that he is known for, Wilson works in his business as a taxi driver. He dedicates around 10 hours daily to his job and he can attend to almost 40 customers a day. He believes that his business is going well because he is very friendly with the customers and there is a big need for people to get around in his area.

Wilson is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help that they have provided, he will be able to perform general maintenance to his car, such as revision of the vehicle engine. In this way, he will drive the car in optimal conditions and be able to drive with greater safety, as much for his customers as for him. He will be able to continue working to make his greatest dream come true: have a fleet of taxis.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer muy alegre de 38 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo Julián de 12 años, a quien le brinda amor y mucho cuidado desde que se separó con su esposo.
Su negocio es la venta de comestibles en la tienda que tiene en su casa, ella es perseverante en la actividad que realiza y está constante en su tienda. Considera que es una labor que le da tiempo para su hijo y los deberes de su hogar y con la que puede ser independiente. Lleva 13 años vendiendo abarrotes, verduras y lo necesario para las amas de casa. Sus clientes acuden a su puesto por la buena atención que Lidia les brinda, es por ello que siempre tiene ingresos económicos con los que puede solventar los gastos de su hijo. Su mayor prioridad es incrementar de productos su negocio para subir sus ventas.

Éste es su crédito número 11 con MFP, se siente contenta por seguir teniendo este apoyo económico, y siendo así podrá continuar con su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia que no duda en dar su opinión para las actividades.
Con los 3,500 nuevos soles que solicita comprará arroz, azúcar, conservas, carne, entre otros.
texts.en:
Lidia is a very happy 38 year old woman. She lives in her own house along with her son, Julian, who is 12, to whom she provides love and much care since she separated from her husband.

Her business is selling food in the shop she has in her house. She is perseverant in the activity she performs and is always in her shop. She considers that it is a job that gives her time for her son and her home chores and with which she can be independent. She has 13 years experience selling groceries, vegetables, and whatever is necessary for housewives. Her customers comer to her shop for the good service that Lidia provides. It is due to this that she always has economic income with which she can pay expenses for her son. Her greatest priority is to increase the products of her business in order to increase sales. 

This is her 11th loan with MFP. She feels happy to continue having this economic support and being able to continue with her work. In her community bank, she is a member who does not hesitate to give her opinion about work. With the 3,500 new "soles" that she is requesting, she will buy rice, sugar, preserves, meat, among other items.

loans.use: to increase merchandise.

loans.name: 3.14. 153.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Hoa  has a service business tailor-made. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair service.

Hoa is 53 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 3.14. 153.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

This is Hoa's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair service.

loans.name: Dativa De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Dativa mujer trabajadora y responsable hace ya treinta y cinco años que se desempeña como Tecnica-Quirurjica en uno de los hospitales situado dentro de uno de los departamentos  de nuestro pais Nicaragua. Madre de dos hijos ya profesionales por lo que dice sentirse mas que feliz pues uno de sus objetivos era ver un dia convertidos a sus hijos en personas que sean util a la sociedad. Su esposo quien es Ingeniero Civil es de gran apoyo para ella ya que siempre han compartido gastos asi como tambien sueños que con la ayuda de Dios y la micro-financiera han podido alcanzarlos. Y quien mejor que su señor esposo para saber precios y dirigir este nuevo proyecto que se propone con este prestamo  el cual es llevar a cabo la construccion de servicio higienico haciendo uso de los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, arena, piedrin, hierro, estribos, bloques, laminas de zinc, inodoro, lavamanos, mangueras flexibles, tubos, puertas, ceramica, azulejo entre otros. Obteniendo con esta instalacion mejores condiciones de salud y evitando asi muchas enfermedades producto a la mala higiene.
texts.en:
Dativa is a hard-working and responsable woman.  She has worked for 35 years as a surgical technician in one of the hospitals within one of the departments in our country, Nicaragua.

She has two children, who are professionals.  She says that she feels more than happy about this.  One of her objectives was to one day she her children become useful people to society.  Her husband, a civil engineer, is a great support for her because they have always shared the expenses and also their dreams.  With God’s help and the micro loan they have been able to achieve them.

Who better than her husband to know prices and to direct this new proposed project with this loan?  The project is to carry out the construction of a bathroom by making use of the following construction materials:  cement, sand, gravel, iron, struts, concrete blocks, zinc sheeting, toilet, sink, flexible hoses, pipes, doors, and ceramic tiles, among others.

This installation improves health conditions and avoids a lot of illnesses that are due to poor hygiene.

loans.use: to install a bathroom.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía tiene 64 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor, de 70 años, y sus dos queridos hijos; Anderson de 20 y Dina de 32 años; quienes dependen aun de sus padres.
Ella es una mujer que a pesar de su edad no impide que siga laborando en la actividad que más le gusta: cultivar y cosechar sus plantas cacao. Actividad que realiza hace más de 43 años con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos. Esta labor es muy trabajosa, pero ya con todo el tiempo de experiencia se le hizo fácil, pues es lo que mejor sabe hacer. Las cosechas que obtiene en su temporada las llevan a comercializar a los centros de acopio, quienes les pagan muy bien por los frutos de cacao. 

Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP y agradece por la confianza que le brindan. Además, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago; al igual que reconoce el empeño de sus compañeros de banco comunal, en el cual se siente contenta porque son personas solidarias. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita realizará el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao, por lo que comprará fertilizantes y abono.
texts.en:
Lucía, 64, lives in her own house with her husband Victor, 70, and their two children, Anderson, 20, and Dina, 32, who still depend on their parents.  

She is a woman whose age does not stop her from continuing to work at the activity that she most enjoys: cultivated and harvesting her cacao plants.  She has done this work for more than 43 years with the help of her husband and children.  This work is very hard, but with the entire length of her experience she finds it easy, since it is what she knows how to do best.  She sells her harvests at collection centers, where they pay very well for cacao.  

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is thankful for the confidence they provide.  She promises to be on time with her payments.  She also recognizes the hard work of the other members of her community bank, where she is very happy because they are supportive people.  With the 2000 nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer and manure to maintain her cacao plants.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Empeñoso y activo, es Luis, de 23 años de edad. Está separado de su pareja y de su pequeño hijo Diego de 2 años; a quien a pesar de todo, le brinda amor y todo su apoyo para seguir adelante.

Su labor es labrar la tierra y cultivar plantas de cacao que le son muy rentables. Esta labor la realiza desde hace 5 años, normalmente lo hace solo, pero en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros para que le ayuden a extraer de forma más rápida los granos de cacao. 
Con el tiempo desea en ampliar su parcela para cultivar más plantas de cacao y café, y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos. Pero su prioridad ahora es incrementar su producción de cacao.

Éste es su tercer crédito con MFP, por ello agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir con sus objetivos. Además, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son personas responsables. 
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará plantitas de cacao para cultivar en su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Luis, 23, is hardworking and active.  He is separated from his partner and his son Diego, who is two years old.  In spite of everything, he gives him love and all of his support to grow. 

His work is tilling the land and cultivating cacao plants, which are very profitable.  He has done this work for five years.  Normally he works alone, but during harvest time, he has the support of day laborers, who help him harvest the cacao beans more quickly.  In time he hopes to expand his land to cultivate more cacao plants and coffee, so that he can earn more income.  His priority now is increasing his cacao production.

This is his third loan with MFP, and he is thankful for the financial support that he receives to continue with his objectives.  He is also glad to be a part of his community bank because the members are responsible people.  With the 3000 nuevos soles that he is requesting, he will purchase cacao seedlings to plant in his fields.

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants.

loans.name: Paula Del Socorro

texts.es: Paula es una señora con metas a futuro. Su profesion ha sido la docencia mas de dieciocho años desempeñandola. su esposo mes a mes recibe una pension por ser el ya jubilado, y juntos esperan hacer las mejoras a su vivienda. Pues gracias Afodenic han logrado la mayor parte de construcción de su casa. Siendo este su quinto ciclo de credito el cual será para el comienzo de un muro en la parte de atrás de la casa, ya que en el invierno las correntadas le inundan su patio de agua y quiere mejorar esta condición evitando malas higiene, lo que espera cerrarlo por completo a la largo plazo ya que su capacidad de pago es poca y tiene que a sumir otros gastos. Para ello necesitara comprar bloques, cemento, piedras canteras, alambre de amarre, estribos, clavos, tablas, piedrin, arena, hierro entre otros y asi empezar la obra. Expresa que alcanzando otros proyectos mas en la infraestrcutura de su vivienda se sentira complacida ya que esta inviertiendo para el futuro de sus hijos y demas familiares.
texts.en:
Paula is a woman with goals for the future.  She has been a teacher by profession, and she has been doing that for 18 years.  Her husband receives a pension for being retired.  Together they hope to make improvements to their house.

Thanks to Afodenic they have managed to do the greatest part of the construction on their house.  This is her fifth loan cycle, and it is to start a wall in the part that is in back of the house.  In winter the torrential rains flood her patio with water.  She wants to improve this condition and avoid poor hygiene.  

She hopes to completely close the wall in the long term.  Her capacity to pay is small, and she does have to assume other expenses.  She will need to buy concrete blocks, quarry stone, wire, buttresses, nails, boards, gravel, sand, and iron, among others.

This way the work can start.  She says that she will be happy to complete other projects on the infrastructure of her house.  They are investing in the future of their children and the rest of the family.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura una mujer muy alegre de 32 años, vive junto a Wilmer, de 34 años, en su casa propia y con sus tres hijos, a quienes les brindan mucho amor.

Ella y su pareja se dedican a la agricultura, gracias a ello se compraron una camioneta, con la que ahora su esposo hace servicio de transporte de pasajeros a diferentes localidades desde muy temprano por la mañana. Mientras tanto, Maura está al pendiente de sus hijos en su casa, pero los fines de semana se dirigen a su parcela donde tienen plantas de cacao. 
Hace 12 años que Maura aprendió sobre el cultivo de cacao, y hace 3 meses que su esposo lleva laborando como la camioneta. Sus planes a futuro son de lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan una mejor calidad de vida. 

Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero; así se siente segura de avanzar con su y trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia activa y responsable.
Con el préstamo que solicita comprará repuestos para su carro, y con lo poco que le sobrará echará abono a su parcela.
texts.en:
Maura, 32, is a happy woman who lives with Wilmer, 34, in their own house with their three children, to whom they give a lot of love.  

She and her partner work in agriculture, and thanks to that work, they purchased a van.  Her husband provides transportation to passengers to different areas starting very early in the morning.  Maura takes care of the children at home, but on the weekends they go to their plot of land where they have cacao plants.  It has been twelve years since Maura learned about cultivating cacao, and her husband has been driving the van for three months.  Her future plans are for her children to become professionals and have a better quality of life.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support so that she feels secure in advancing with her work.  She promises to make her payments on time.  In her community bank, she is an active and responsible member.  With the loan requested, she will purchase parts for her vehicle and with the little remaining, she will purchase fertilizer for her land.

loans.use: to purchase parts for her van.

loans.name: Delky

texts.es:
Delki tiene 29 años, es una mujer  trabajadora y con muchas ganas de progresar, además es amable y cordial con las personas. Vive con Javier, quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus dos hijos; Natali y José  de 4 y 2 años respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente en la casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.

Su actividad es la venta de productos comestibles (bebidas y abarrotes) en una bodega que implementó en su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente  a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Inició hace más de 4 años con un préstamo del banco, más sus ahorros, comprando en pequeñas cantidades, y viendo la acogida que tenía su negocio decidió continuar y hasta el momento realiza sola la atención al público. Considera que su negocio es rentable por las ganancias que le deja, pues le permite mantener a su familia y reinvertir. 
Decidió empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y tener ingresos económicos para apoyar a su pareja a mantener a su familia, y en un futuro desea convertirse en una próspera empresaria. Por tanto, y viendo los resultados que sigue teniendo, desea aumentar el stock de sus productos y ver crecer su negocio.

Éste es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el crédito anterior, y de esa manera tener un buen perfil crediticio y acceso a otros créditos en el futuro.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como; bebidas gasificadas, abarrotes en general y otros, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, así mantener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Delky is a 29-year-old hard-working woman, is eager to make progress, and is friendly and cordial with people.
